analyzed: de lta na yang /
translated: then in that case as well,

original: gal te skye ba 'phyi 'gyur la //
analyzed: gal te skye ba 'phyi 'gyur la //
translated: If birth occurs later

original: rga shi snga ba yin na ni //
analyzed: rga shi snga ba yin na ni //
translated: and aging and death occur earlier,🔽how could there be

original: skye ba med pa'i rga shi ni //🔽rgyu med par ni ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i rga shi ni // rgyu med par ni ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: aging and death without birth?

original: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ba 'byung bas na /
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ba 'byung bas na /
translated: Since it is said that “aging and death occur due to the condition of birth,”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rga shi skye ba'i rgyu rkyen nyid du gsungs na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rga shi skye ba'i rgyu rkyen nyid du gsungs na /
translated: the Bhagavān has stated that aging and death are the conditions of birth.

original: gal te 'di snga ba yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'di snga ba yin na ni /
translated: If this is earlier,

original: de'i tshe rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would be causeless.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, this is not reasonable.🔽As it is said:

original: gang las / bong ba bteg par gyur pa ni //🔽bteg pa la ni rgyu yod kyi //
analyzed: gang las / bong ba bteg par gyur pa ni // bteg pa la ni rgyu yod kyi //
translated: When a clod is lifted up,🔽the cause of lifting exists.

original: bteg pa lta zhig rgyu las ni //
analyzed: bteg pa lta zhig rgyu las ni //
translated: But the cause of falling

original: gzhan pa ltung ba med pa nyid //
analyzed: gzhan pa ltung ba med pa nyid //
translated: is not different from the cause of lifting.

original: ces bshad pa de yang ji ltar bteg pa kho nar ltung ba'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: ces bshad pa de yang ji ltar bteg pa kho nar ltung ba'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: In that case, just as the cause of falling is the same as the cause of lifting,

original: gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: and not different,

original: 'dir yang skye ba kho na 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid yin par smra'i gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang skye ba kho na 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid yin par smra'i gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: in the same way, here also, the cause of destruction is the same as the cause of arising, and not different.

original: de'i phyir 'jig pa rgyu med pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig pa rgyu med pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, destruction does not exist without a cause.

original: 'di skye ba'i rgyu rkyen nyid yin pas 'byung ba kho na 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'di skye ba'i rgyu rkyen nyid yin pas 'byung ba kho na 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: Since it is the cause of arising, the element is the cause of destruction.

original: de ltar 'dus byas chos de @77a * //
analyzed: de ltar 'dus byas chos de @77a * //
translated: Thus, those conditioned phenomena

original: dag / rgyu dang bcas par 'byung ba ste //
analyzed: dag / rgyu dang bcas par 'byung ba ste //
translated: arise with a cause.

original: skyes nas 'jig pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: skyes nas 'jig pa gang yin pa //
translated: Whatever arises, ceases.

original: 'di ni chos rnams rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ni chos rnams rang bzhin no //
translated: This is the nature of phenomena.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di yang legs par drangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di yang legs par drangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: This verse is also well cited.

original: da ni skye ba dang rga shi dag lhan cig nyid du yang mi 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni skye ba dang rga shi dag lhan cig nyid du yang mi 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that birth and aging and death are not coexistent,🔽Birth and aging and death

original: skye ba dang ni rga shi dag / lhan cig rung ba ma yin te //
analyzed: skye ba dang ni rga shi dag / lhan cig rung ba ma yin te //
translated: Are not coexistent.

original: skye bzhin pa na 'chi 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa na 'chi 'gyur zhing //
translated: If one were to die while being born,

original: gnyi ga rgyu med can du 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gnyi ga rgyu med can du 'gyur // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Both would be causeless.

original: gal te skye ba dang rga shi dag lhan cig pa nyid du 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te skye ba dang rga shi dag lhan cig pa nyid du 'gyur na ni /
translated: If birth and aging and death were coexistent,

original: de'i tshe skye bzhin pa 'chi bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe skye bzhin pa 'chi bar 'gyur na /
translated: then at that time one would die while being born.

original: 'di ni rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But this is not logical.

original: mun pa dang snang ba ltar phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir dus gcig pa nyid du rigs pa yang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: mun pa dang snang ba ltar phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir dus gcig pa nyid du rigs pa yang ma yin zhing /
translated: It is not logical that they are coexistent, like light and darkness, because they are mutually exclusive.

original: skye bzhin pa nyid 'chi ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa de lta bu ni 'jig rten du yang ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa nyid 'chi ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa de lta bu ni 'jig rten du yang ma mthong ngo //
translated: And in the world, one never sees that which is called “dying while being born.”

original: gzhan yang skye ba la sogs pa dag lhan cig 'byung bar rtog na ni rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang skye ba la sogs pa dag lhan cig 'byung bar rtog na ni rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if birth, etc., are conceived to occur simultaneously, they would be causeless.

original: ba glang gi rva g-yas g-yon lhan cig tu gyur pa dag ni phan tshun gyi rgyu can nyid du mthong ba yang ma yin pas /🔽'di ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: ba glang gi rva g-yas g-yon lhan cig tu gyur pa dag ni phan tshun gyi rgyu can nyid du mthong ba yang ma yin pas / 'di ni mi rigs so //
translated: And the right and left horns of an ox, which occur simultaneously, are not seen to be the cause of each other.🔽Therefore, this is not reasonable.

original: de'i phyir de ltar /🔽gang la snga phyi lhan cig gi //🔽rim pa de dag mi srid pa'i //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar / gang la snga phyi lhan cig gi // rim pa de dag mi srid pa'i //
translated: Thus,

original: skye ba de dang rga shi de //
analyzed: skye ba de dang rga shi de //
translated: That birth and that aging and death🔽In which these sequences🔽Are not possible

original: ci yi phyir na spro bar byed //
analyzed: ci yi phyir na spro bar byed //
translated: Why would the noble ones elaborate them?

original: skye ba gang dang rga shi gang la snga ba dang 'phyi ba dang lhan cig gi rim pa de dag med pa'i skye ba de ma dmigs pa na /
analyzed: skye ba gang dang rga shi gang la snga ba dang 'phyi ba dang lhan cig gi rim pa de dag med pa'i skye ba de ma dmigs pa na /
translated: In regard to that birth and that aging and death in which these sequences—prior, subsequent, and simultaneous—are not possible, since that birth is not apprehended,

original: 'phags pa rnams ci'i phyir spro bar byed /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams ci'i phyir spro bar byed /
translated: why would the noble ones elaborate them?

original: ci'i phyir gyi sgra ni mi srid pa la bya ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gyi sgra ni mi srid pa la bya ste /
translated: The word “why” indicates impossibility.

original: spro bar mi mdzad pa nyid do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: spro bar mi mdzad pa nyid do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they would not elaborate them at all.

original: rga shi de yang ma dmigs na ci'i phyir spro bar byed /
analyzed: rga shi de yang ma dmigs na ci'i phyir spro bar byed /
translated: Since that aging and death is not apprehended, why would they elaborate them?

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gzigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro snyam du dgongs so //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gzigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro snyam du dgongs so //
translated: because they see things as they really are.

original: yang na de ltar skye ba la sogs pa dag yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: yang na de ltar skye ba la sogs pa dag yod pa ma yin na /
translated: Or else, if arising, etc. do not exist,

original: byis pa rnams yod pa ma yin pa'i skye ba de dang / gang zhig yod pa ma yin pa'i rga shi de ci'i phyir spro bar byed /
analyzed: byis pa rnams yod pa ma yin pa'i skye ba de dang / gang zhig yod pa ma yin pa'i rga shi de ci'i phyir spro bar byed /
translated: why do fools delight in that non-existent arising and that non-existent aging and death?

original: de'i phyir byis pa rnams kyis spros pa ni dngos po yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir byis pa rnams kyis spros pa ni dngos po yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the thought is that the conceptual elaboration of fools is just the non-existence of things.

original: ji ltar 'khor ba la sngon gyi mtha' yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du dngos po gzhan rnams la yang yin no zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'khor ba la sngon gyi mtha' yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du dngos po gzhan rnams la yang yin no zhes gsungs pa /
translated: Just as cyclic existence has no prior limit, so also other things have no prior limit.

original: 'khor ba 'ba' zhig sngon gyi mtha' //
analyzed: 'khor ba 'ba' zhig sngon gyi mtha' //
translated: Cyclic existence alone has no prior limit.

original: yod ma yin par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: yod ma yin par ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only that,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid dang ni //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid dang ni //
translated: but also cause and effect,

original: mtshan nyid dang ni mtshan gzhi nyid //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ni mtshan gzhi nyid //
translated: characterized and characteristic,

original: tshor dang tshor po @77b nyid dang ni //
analyzed: tshor dang tshor po @77b nyid dang ni //
translated: feeling and the feeler,

original: don yod gang dag ci yang rung //
analyzed: don yod gang dag ci yang rung //
translated: and whatever else there is.

original: dngos rnams thams cad nyid la yang //
analyzed: dngos rnams thams cad nyid la yang //
translated: All things

original: sngon gyi mtha' ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' ni yod ma yin //
translated: have no prior limit.

original: de la gal te rgyu snga la 'bras bu 'phyi bar gyur na ni /
analyzed: de la gal te rgyu snga la 'bras bu 'phyi bar gyur na ni /
translated: If the cause is prior and the effect is later,

original: 'bras bu med pa'i rgyu rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i rgyu rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the cause would be without an effect, and would be causeless.

original: 'on te 'bras bu snga la rgyu 'phyi na ni /
analyzed: 'on te 'bras bu snga la rgyu 'phyi na ni /
translated: But if the effect is prior and the cause is later,

original: de lta na yang rgyu bas snga ba'i 'bras bu rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang rgyu bas snga ba'i 'bras bu rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then the effect would be without a cause, and would be prior to the cause.

original: ci ste rgyu dang 'bras bu cig car du gyur na ni /
analyzed: ci ste rgyu dang 'bras bu cig car du gyur na ni /
translated: If the cause and effect are simultaneous,

original: de lta na yang gnyi ga rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang gnyi ga rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then both would be without a cause.

original: de bzhin du mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi dag dang / tshor ba dang tshor ba po dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi dag dang / tshor ba dang tshor ba po dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the characteristic and the characterized, and the feeler and the feeling should be applied.🔽The explanation of the cause of cyclic existence

original: 'khor ba'i rgyu bshad pa rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa bshad par bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgyu bshad pa rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa bshad par bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: It is not only the cause and effect, etc., that should be explained.

original: gzhan yang dngos po gzhan gang dag shes pa dang shes bya dang / tshad ma dang gzhal bya dang / bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed dang // yan lag dang yan lag can dang / yon tan dang yon tan can la sogs pa de dag la yang sngon gyi mtha' mi rigs so zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang dngos po gzhan gang dag shes pa dang shes bya dang / tshad ma dang gzhal bya dang / bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed dang // yan lag dang yan lag can dang / yon tan dang yon tan can la sogs pa de dag la yang sngon gyi mtha' mi rigs so zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be applied to other things, such as cognition and the cognized, valid cognition and the object of valid cognition, the probandum and the proof, the part and the whole, the quality and the qualified, and so on.

original: de nyid kyi phyir //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir //
translated: For this very reason,

original: 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin gyi mdo las //
analyzed: 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin gyi mdo las //
translated: in the noble Cloud of Jewels Sutra,🔽the noble great bodhisattva Sarva­nīvaraṇa­viṣkam­bhin praises the Blessed One:🔽“The wheel of Dharma was turned,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang // gzod nas zhi zhing mi skyes pa //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang // gzod nas zhi zhing mi skyes pa //
translated: primordially peaceful and unborn.

original: rang gzhan mya ngan 'das pa yi //
analyzed: rang gzhan mya ngan 'das pa yi //
translated: The nirvāṇa of self and other,

original: chos rnams mgon po khyod kyis bstan //🔽zhes 'phags pa byang chub sems dpa' chen po sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel bas bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa yin no //
analyzed: chos rnams mgon po khyod kyis bstan // zhes 'phags pa byang chub sems dpa' chen po sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel bas bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa yin no //
translated: the protector taught these phenomena.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly,

original: gzod ma nas ni stong zhing ma 'ongs chos //
analyzed: gzod ma nas ni stong zhing ma 'ongs chos //
translated: primordially empty, future phenomena

original: song ba med cing gnas med gnas kyis dben //
analyzed: song ba med cing gnas med gnas kyis dben //
translated: are not gone, not abiding, devoid of abiding.

original: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin rtag tu snying po med //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin rtag tu snying po med //
translated: The nature of illusions is always essenceless.

original: thams cad dag cing rnam dag nam mkha' bzhin //
analyzed: thams cad dag cing rnam dag nam mkha' bzhin //
translated: All are pure, completely pure, like space.

original: rgyal ba'i chos ni gang dag rab ston pa //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i chos ni gang dag rab ston pa //
translated: The Dharma that the Victor teaches

original: der yang mi zad pas ni mi mthong ste //
analyzed: der yang mi zad pas ni mi mthong ste //
translated: is not seen because it is inexhaustible.

original: chos 'di snga nas bdag med sems can med //
analyzed: chos 'di snga nas bdag med sems can med //
translated: This Dharma is from the beginning selfless and without sentient beings.

original: de dag rab tu ston kyang mi zad 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag rab tu ston kyang mi zad 'gyur //
translated: Even though it is taught, it is inexhaustible.

original: btags pa tsam du brtags nas bstan pa yin //
analyzed: btags pa tsam du brtags nas bstan pa yin //
translated: It is taught after being imputed as mere imputations.

original: 'khor ba la ni tha ma mi rnyed de //
analyzed: 'khor ba la ni tha ma mi rnyed de //
translated: An end of saṃsāra is not found.

original: gang dag sngon byung mtha' ni mtshan nyid med ;
analyzed: gang dag sngon byung mtha' ni mtshan nyid med ;
translated: The past limit that has occurred has no characteristics.

original: / ma 'ongs dus kyang shes par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: / ma 'ongs dus kyang shes par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to know the future time,

original: las dang bya ba de ltar zhugs 'gyur te //
analyzed: las dang bya ba de ltar zhugs 'gyur te //
translated: one engages in actions and activities.

original: rab dang tha ma dag tu 'ang 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rab dang tha ma dag tu 'ang 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: They also occur in the best and the worst.

original: chos rnams rab tu blun zhing rang bzhin stong //
analyzed: chos rnams rab tu blun zhing rang bzhin stong //
translated: Dharmas are completely stupid and empty by nature.

original: thams cad bdag med par yang shes par gyis //
analyzed: thams cad bdag med par yang shes par gyis //
translated: Know that all are selfless.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo /
translated: And so on.

original: @78a * // slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas sbyar ba'i tshig gsal ba las /
analyzed: @78a * // slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas sbyar ba'i tshig gsal ba las /
translated: This is the commentary on the twenty-first chapter, having twenty-two🔽verses, called “the examination of the self.”🔽🔽CHAPTER TWENTY-TWO🔽Examination of the Prior Entity🔽Explanation of the Chapter🔽This section has two parts: the refutation of the essential existence of cyclic🔽existence and nirvana and showing that thereby the errors of nihilism and reification are avoided.🔽Refutation of the essential existence of cyclic existence and🔽nirvana🔽This section has two parts: the refutation of the essential existence of cyclic🔽existence and nirvana and showing that thereby the errors of nihilism and🔽reification are avoided.🔽Refutation of the essential existence of cyclic existence and🔽nirvana🔽This section has two parts: the refutation of the essential existence of cyclic🔽existence and nirvana and showing that thereby the errors of nihilism and🔽reification are avoided.🔽Refutation of the essential existence of cyclic existence and🔽nirvana🔽This section has two parts: the refutation of the essential existence of cyclic🔽existence and nirvana and showing that thereby the errors of nihilism and🔽reification are avoided.🔽Refutation of the essential existence of cyclic existence and🔽nirvana🔽This section has two parts: the refutation of the essential existence of cyclic🔽existence and nirvana and showing that thereby the errors of nihilism and🔽reification are avoided.🔽

original: sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' brtag pa zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa bcu gcig pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' brtag pa zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa bcu gcig pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the eleventh chapter, the analysis of the beginning and end, in the Ornament of the Middle Way.

original: // /'dir smras pa //
analyzed: // /'dir smras pa //
translated: Here someone might say,

original: bdag ni yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdag ni yod pa nyid do //
translated: “The self exists.

original: de dang 'brel pa can gyi sdug bsngal yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa can gyi sdug bsngal yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the suffering that is related to it exists.

original: 'dir nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la sdug bsngal zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la sdug bsngal zhes brjod do //
translated: Here, the five appropriated aggregates are called suffering.

original: de yang yod la /
analyzed: de yang yod la /
translated: And that exists.

original: sdug bsngal de yang 'ga' zhig la 'gyur bar bya dgos te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal de yang 'ga' zhig la 'gyur bar bya dgos te /
translated: And that suffering must be related to someone.

original: rten med par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rten med par ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not exist without a basis.

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal la rten yod pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal la rten yod pa nyid yin la /
translated: Therefore, the basis of suffering exists.

original: de yang bdag yin no //
analyzed: de yang bdag yin no //
translated: And that is the self.”

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: gal te sdug bsngal nyid yod na /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal nyid yod na /
translated: If suffering itself existed,

original: bdag yod par 'gyur na yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag yod par 'gyur na yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: the self would exist. But it does not.

original: 'di ltar de ni yod na /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni yod na /
translated: If it existed,

original: bdag gis byas pa'am /
analyzed: bdag gis byas pa'am /
translated: it would have to be either produced by the self,

original: gzhan gyis byas pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa'am /
translated: produced by another,🔽produced by both,

original: gnyi gas byas pa'am /
analyzed: gnyi gas byas pa'am /
translated: or🔽arisen without a cause.

original: rgyu dang bral ba zhig tu 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: rgyu dang bral ba zhig tu 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: It would be without a cause.

original: 'dod pa na yang rnam pa thams cad du de byas pa nyid yod pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: 'dod pa na yang rnam pa thams cad du de byas pa nyid yod pa ma yin no ;
translated: But in the desire realm, it is not produced in any way.

original: ; zhes bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ; zhes bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: To demonstrate this, it is said:

original: kha cig sdug bsngal bdag gis byas //
analyzed: kha cig sdug bsngal bdag gis byas //
translated: Some assert that suffering is self-produced,

original: gzhan gyis byas dang gnyi gas byas //
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas dang gnyi gas byas //
translated: Produced by another, produced by both,

original: rgyu med pa las 'byung bar 'dod //
analyzed: rgyu med pa las 'byung bar 'dod //
translated: Or that it occurs without a cause.

original: de ni bya bar mi rung ngo //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //🔽de la rgol ba kha cig gis ni /
analyzed: de ni bya bar mi rung ngo // zhes bya ba gsungs so // de la rgol ba kha cig gis ni /
translated: This is unacceptable.

original: sdug bsngal bdag gis byas so zhes bya ba rtogs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bdag gis byas so zhes bya ba rtogs so //
translated: Regarding this, some opponents understand that suffering is self-produced.

original: gzhan po dag gis ni gzhan gyos byas pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan po dag gis ni gzhan gyos byas pa yin la /
translated: Others understand that it is produced by another.

original: gzhan dag gis ni gnyi gas byas pa yin zhing 'ga' zhig dag gis ni sdug bsngal rgyu med par 'byung ba nyid do zhes bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis ni gnyi gas byas pa yin zhing 'ga' zhig dag gis ni sdug bsngal rgyu med par 'byung ba nyid do zhes bya bar rtogs so //
translated: Still others understand that it is produced by both. And some understand that suffering occurs without a cause.

original: 'dod par gyur pa'i sdug bsngal de ni rnam pa thams cad du bya bar te bskyed par bya bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'dod par gyur pa'i sdug bsngal de ni rnam pa thams cad du bya bar te bskyed par bya bar mi rung ngo //
translated: But that suffering that is desired is unacceptable in any way, that is, it is unacceptable that it is produced.

original: 'di ni dam bca' ba tsam yin pa de bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di ni dam bca' ba tsam yin pa de bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: This is just a thesis. In order to prove it, he says:

original: gal te bdag gis byas gyur na //
analyzed: gal te bdag gis byas gyur na //
translated: If it were produced by itself,

original: de phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: then it would not arise in dependence.

original: gang phyir phung po 'di dag la //
analyzed: gang phyir phung po 'di dag la //
translated: Because these aggregates

original: brten nas phung po 'di dag 'byung //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: brten nas phung po 'di dag 'byung // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: arise in dependence on those aggregates.

original: de la bdag gis zhes bya ba ni bdag rang gis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la bdag gis zhes bya ba ni bdag rang gis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Here, “by itself” means “by itself alone.”

original: gal te bdag gis sdug bsngal byas par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te bdag gis sdug bsngal byas par gyur na ni /
translated: If suffering were produced by itself,

original: sdug bsngal gyi rang gi ngo bo de nyid kyis sdug bsngal gyi rang gi ngo bo de nyid byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rang gi ngo bo de nyid kyis sdug bsngal gyi rang gi ngo bo de nyid byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: then that very intrinsic nature of suffering would be produced by that very intrinsic nature of suffering.

original: de ci'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Why would it not arise in dependence?🔽It would arise without depending on causes and conditions.

original: rgyu dang rkyen la mi ltos par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don @78b te ;
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen la mi ltos par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don @78b te ;
translated: This is the meaning.

original: rang gi ngo bo yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would exist by its own intrinsic nature.

original: yod pa ma yin pas ni rang gi ngo bo byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pas ni rang gi ngo bo byed pa ma yin no //
translated: That which does not exist does not produce its own intrinsic nature.

original: 'di ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yang yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yang yin te /
translated: This is also dependent origination.🔽Thus:

original: 'di ltar / gang phyir phung po 'di dag la //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gang phyir phung po 'di dag la //
translated: Because these aggregates

original: brten nas phung po de dag 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: brten nas phung po de dag 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: are the basis for the arising of those aggregates.

original: gang gi phyir /🔽'chi ba'i dus kyi phung po 'di dag la brten nas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir / 'chi ba'i dus kyi phung po 'di dag la brten nas /
translated: Because:

original: skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i phung po de dag 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i phung po de dag 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the aggregates at the time of death are the basis for the arising of the aggregates that pertain to birth.

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag gis byas so zhes bya ba mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag gis byas so zhes bya ba mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is illogical to state, “Suffering is self-created.”

original: da ni gzhan gyis byas pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa /🔽gal te 'di las de gzhan zhing //
analyzed: da ni gzhan gyis byas pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa / gal te 'di las de gzhan zhing //
translated: Now, Nāgārjuna explains that it is also illogical for suffering to be created by another:🔽If this were different from that

original: gal te de las 'di gzhan na //
analyzed: gal te de las 'di gzhan na //
translated: and if that were different from this,

original: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas 'gyur zhing //
translated: then suffering would be created by another

original: gzhan de dag gis de byas 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan de dag gis de byas 'gyur //
translated: and that other would create that.

original: gal te 'chi ba'i dus kyi phung po 'di dag las skye ba'i cha'i phung po de dag gzhan du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gal te 'chi ba'i dus kyi phung po 'di dag las skye ba'i cha'i phung po de dag gzhan du 'gyur zhing /
translated: If the aggregates that pertain to birth were different from these aggregates at the time of death,🔽and if these aggregates at the time of death were different from those aggregates that pertain to birth,

original: skye ba'i char gtogs pa de dag las 'chi ba'i dus kyi phung po 'di dag gzhan yin na ni /
analyzed: skye ba'i char gtogs pa de dag las 'chi ba'i dus kyi phung po 'di dag gzhan yin na ni /
translated: If the aggregates at the time of death were different from those at the time of birth,

original: de'i tshe sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par 'gyur na /
translated: then suffering would be produced by another.

original: de dag la ni gzhan nyid ma mthong ste /
analyzed: de dag la ni gzhan nyid ma mthong ste /
translated: But they are not seen to be different from each other,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel par gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel par gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not related as cause and effect.🔽As it will be explained:

original: gang la brten te gang 'byung ba //🔽de ni re zhig de nyid min //
analyzed: gang la brten te gang 'byung ba // de ni re zhig de nyid min //
translated: That which arises in dependence on something🔽is not that,

original: de las gzhan pa'ang ma yin phyir //🔽de phyir tshad min rtag ma yin //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'ang ma yin phyir // de phyir tshad min rtag ma yin //
translated: and it is not different from that.

original: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is neither permanent nor impermanent.

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, suffering is not produced by another.

original: gal te gzhan nyid yin na ni //
analyzed: gal te gzhan nyid yin na ni //
translated: If they were different,🔽then it could be said that those aggregates that are different

original: de yi tshe gzhan nyid yin dang // gzhan du gyur pa'i phung po de dag gis gzhan du gyur pa de dag byas so zhes bya ba brjod par nus par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de yi tshe gzhan nyid yin dang // gzhan du gyur pa'i phung po de dag gis gzhan du gyur pa de dag byas so zhes bya ba brjod par nus par 'gyur na /
translated: produce those that are different.

original: de ni de ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: But that is not the case.

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, suffering is not produced by another.

original: ci ste gang gi phyir sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal byas pa de'i phyir bdag gis byas so zhes ni mi smra'o //
analyzed: ci ste gang gi phyir sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal byas pa de'i phyir bdag gis byas so zhes ni mi smra'o //
translated: But if you think, “Suffering is produced by itself because suffering is produced by itself,”

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: then we reply:🔽If suffering is produced by itself,

original: gang zag bdag gis gang bdag nyid kyis byas pa yin gyi /🔽gzhan gyis byas nas 'di la byin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zag bdag gis gang bdag nyid kyis byas pa yin gyi / gzhan gyis byas nas 'di la byin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: then what is the person who is the experiencer of suffering?🔽What is the person who is the experiencer of suffering?

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag gis byas so zhes smra'o snyam na /
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag gis byas so zhes smra'o snyam na /
translated: If you think that suffering is produced by the person himself, and that it is not given to him by another,

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: then we reply:

original: gal te gang zag bdag gis ni //
analyzed: gal te gang zag bdag gis ni //
translated: If suffering is produced by the person himself,🔽then what is the person who is the experiencer of suffering?🔽If you think that suffering is produced by the person himself,

original: sdug bsngal byas pa'i gang zag ste //
analyzed: sdug bsngal byas pa'i gang zag ste //
translated: then what is the person who is the experiencer of suffering?🔽If you think that suffering is produced by the person himself,

original: sdug bsngal ma gtogs gang zhig yin //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ma gtogs gang zhig yin //
translated: then what is the person who is the experiencer of suffering?

original: gal te mi'i sdug bsngal nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid can 'di gang zag bdag nyid kyis byas so zhes bya bar @79a * //
analyzed: gal te mi'i sdug bsngal nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid can 'di gang zag bdag nyid kyis byas so zhes bya bar @79a * //
translated: If you think that suffering is produced by the person himself,🔽then what is the person who is the experiencer of suffering?

original: rtag na / gang bdag gis sdug bsngal de byas pa'i gang zag te rtog mod /
analyzed: rtag na / gang bdag gis sdug bsngal de byas pa'i gang zag te rtog mod /
translated: If you think that suffering is produced by the person himself,🔽then what is the person who is the experiencer of suffering?

original: gal te re zhig sdug bsngal gang gis gang zag bdag nyid der 'dogs par byed pa'i sdug bsngal de nyid des byas pa yin na ni /🔽sdug bsngal de ni 'di yin la /
analyzed: gal te re zhig sdug bsngal gang gis gang zag bdag nyid der 'dogs par byed pa'i sdug bsngal de nyid des byas pa yin na ni / sdug bsngal de ni 'di yin la /
translated: If the suffering by which the person is designated were produced by that person himself,🔽then it would have to be said that this is the suffering

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni 'di yin no zhes phye ste brjod dgos so //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni 'di yin no zhes phye ste brjod dgos so //
translated: and this is the one who produces it.

original: ci ste yang mi'i sdug bsngal gyi nye bar len pa can gyi gang zag gis /
analyzed: ci ste yang mi'i sdug bsngal gyi nye bar len pa can gyi gang zag gis /
translated: But if the person who appropriates human suffering

original: lha'i sdug bsngal byas par gyur na ni /
analyzed: lha'i sdug bsngal byas par gyur na ni /
translated: were to produce the suffering of a god,

original: 'o na de gang zag bdag gis byas pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'o na de gang zag bdag gis byas pa ma yin gyi /
translated: then the suffering would not be produced by that person himself,

original: gang zag gzhan gyis byas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zag gzhan gyis byas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: but it would be produced by another person.

original: ci ste nye bar len pa tha dad kyang gang zag tha mi dad par 'dod na /
analyzed: ci ste nye bar len pa tha dad kyang gang zag tha mi dad par 'dod na /
translated: But if you assert that although the appropriated aggregates are different, the person is not different,

original: 'di yang yod pa ma yin te /🔽nye bar len pa las tha dad cing /
analyzed: 'di yang yod pa ma yin te / nye bar len pa las tha dad cing /
translated: this is also not possible,

original: gzhan du gyur pa'i gang zag bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa'i gang zag bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible to demonstrate a person who is different from the appropriated aggregates.

original: de ltar na re zhig sdug bsngal gang zag bdag gis byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig sdug bsngal gang zag bdag gis byas pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the suffering is not produced by the person himself.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: gang zag bdag gis sdug bsngal byas so zhes de skad du su smra ;
analyzed: gang zag bdag gis sdug bsngal byas so zhes de skad du su smra ;
translated: Who says that suffering is produced by the person himself?

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What do we say?

original: sdug bsngal ni gang zag gzhan las 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni gang zag gzhan las 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Suffering arises from another person.

original: 'di ltar mi'i gang zag ni lha'i sdug bsngal las gzhan nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi'i gang zag ni lha'i sdug bsngal las gzhan nyid yin la /
translated: In this way, the human person is different from the god’s suffering.

original: gang gi phyir mi'i gang zag gis kyang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi'i gang zag gis kyang /
translated: And because the human person

original: lha'i sdug bsngal byas nas lha'i gang zag la ster bar byed cing /
analyzed: lha'i sdug bsngal byas nas lha'i gang zag la ster bar byed cing /
translated: produces the god’s suffering and gives it to the god person,

original: lha'i sdug bsngal des kyang lha'i gang zag go zhes 'dogs par byed pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: lha'i sdug bsngal des kyang lha'i gang zag go zhes 'dogs par byed pa de'i phyir /
translated: and because the god’s suffering is designated as the god person,

original: gang zag de'i sdug bsngal de ni gang zag gzhan las 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gang zag de'i sdug bsngal de ni gang zag gzhan las 'byung ba yin no //
translated: therefore the god’s suffering arises from another person.

original: brjod par bya ste /🔽gal te gang zag gzhan las ni //
analyzed: brjod par bya ste / gal te gang zag gzhan las ni //
translated: We reply:🔽If suffering arises from another person,

original: sdug bsngal 'byung na gzhan zhig gis //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'byung na gzhan zhig gis //
translated: then another person would produce

original: sdug bsngal de byas gang sbyin de //
analyzed: sdug bsngal de byas gang sbyin de //
translated: the suffering that is given to him.

original: sdug bsngal ma gtogs ci ltar rung //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ma gtogs ci ltar rung //
translated: But how could it be that the person is not suffering?

original: gal te lha'i sdug bsngal mi'i gang zag gis byas la //
analyzed: gal te lha'i sdug bsngal mi'i gang zag gis byas la //
translated: If the human person produces the god’s suffering,

original: mi'i gang zag des kyang sdug bsngal de byas nas //
analyzed: mi'i gang zag des kyang sdug bsngal de byas nas //
translated: And that human person would create that suffering

original: gzhan lha'i gang zag la ster bar byed do zhes bya ba yin na ni /🔽gang la sbyin par bya ba'i lha'i gang zag de /
analyzed: gzhan lha'i gang zag la ster bar byed do zhes bya ba yin na ni / gang la sbyin par bya ba'i lha'i gang zag de /
translated: and give it to the divine person.🔽But how could that divine person,

original: lha'i sdug bsngal las ma gtogs par ji ltar rung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: lha'i sdug bsngal las ma gtogs par ji ltar rung bar 'gyur /
translated: to whom it is given, be tenable except as divine suffering?

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: In that case,

original: re zhig gang zag gzhan las 'byung ba'i sdug bsngal la len pa po nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: re zhig gang zag gzhan las 'byung ba'i sdug bsngal la len pa po nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: first, the appropriator of suffering that arises from another person does not exist.

original: da ni gang zhig sbyin par byed pa de yang yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni gang zhig sbyin par byed pa de yang yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa /
translated: Now, it is said that the one who gives it also does not exist:

original: gal te gang zag gzhan sdug bsngal //
analyzed: gal te gang zag gzhan sdug bsngal //
translated: If the suffering of another person

original: 'byung na gang gis de byas nas //
analyzed: 'byung na gang gis de byas nas //
translated: arises, by whom is it created🔽and given to another?

original: gzhan la ster ba'i gang zag @79b gzhan //
analyzed: gzhan la ster ba'i gang zag @79b gzhan //
translated: What is the other person,

original: sdug bsngal ma gtogs gang zhig yin //🔽gang gis lha'i sdug bsngal byas nas lha'i gang zag la ster bar byed cing /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ma gtogs gang zhig yin // gang gis lha'i sdug bsngal byas nas lha'i gang zag la ster bar byed cing /
translated: apart from the suffering?

original: nye bar len pa gang gis mi'i gang zag der gdags pa de ni /
analyzed: nye bar len pa gang gis mi'i gang zag der gdags pa de ni /
translated: By whom is the divine suffering created and given to the divine person, and by what appropriation is that human person designated?

original: mi'i nye bar len pa las tha dad pa gang zhig yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: mi'i nye bar len pa las tha dad pa gang zhig yin par 'gyur /
translated: What else, apart from the human appropriator, could it be?

original: de'i phyir gang zag gzhan las byung ba'i sdug bsngal yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zag gzhan las byung ba'i sdug bsngal yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, suffering does not arise from another person.

original: de'i phyir / bdag gis byas par ma grub pas //🔽sdug bsngal gzhan gyis ga la byas //
analyzed: de'i phyir / bdag gis byas par ma grub pas // sdug bsngal gzhan gyis ga la byas //
translated: Therefore: Since self-produced suffering does not exist,🔽How can suffering be produced by another?

original: gzhan gyis sdug bsngal gang byed pa //
analyzed: gzhan gyis sdug bsngal gang byed pa //
translated: If suffering were produced by another,

original: de ni de yi bdag byas 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni de yi bdag byas 'gyur //
translated: That other would be the producer of suffering.

original: gal te lha'i gang zag gis sdug bsngal mi'i gang zag gis byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te lha'i gang zag gis sdug bsngal mi'i gang zag gis byas pa'i phyir /
translated: If the suffering of the human person were produced by the divine person,

original: gzhan gyis byas pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa yin na ni /
translated: then suffering would be produced by another.

original: de ni mi'i gang zag gi rang gis byas pa nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: de ni mi'i gang zag gi rang gis byas pa nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: But that would be self-produced by the human person.

original: de yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: But that does not exist.

original: de'i phyir / gang gi tshe bdag gis byas par ma grub pa'i phyir sdug bsngal de mi'i gang zag gi bdag gis ma byas pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de'i phyir / gang gi tshe bdag gis byas par ma grub pa'i phyir sdug bsngal de mi'i gang zag gi bdag gis ma byas pa de'i tshe /
translated: Therefore, since self-produced suffering does not exist, suffering is not produced by the human person himself.

original: lha zhes bya ba'i gang zag gzhan gyi sdug bsngal de gzhan gyis byas par ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di las kyang sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lha zhes bya ba'i gang zag gzhan gyi sdug bsngal de gzhan gyis byas par ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di las kyang sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: How could the suffering of another person called a “god” be created by another?

original: da ni phyogs gnyis char rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas kyang yod pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni phyogs gnyis char rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas kyang yod pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that it does not exist in either of the two parts in another way, he says:

original: re zhig sdug bsngal bdag byas min //
analyzed: re zhig sdug bsngal bdag byas min //
translated: Suffering is not self-created.

original: de nyid kyis ni de ma byas //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni de ma byas //
translated: It is not created by itself.

original: gal te gzhan bdag ma byas na //
analyzed: gal te gzhan bdag ma byas na //
translated: If it is not created by another,

original: sdug bsngal gzhan byas ga la 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //🔽'di las kyang sdug bsngal bdag dang gzhan dag gis byas par mi rigs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhan byas ga la 'gyur // zhes bya ba gsungs so // 'di las kyang sdug bsngal bdag dang gzhan dag gis byas par mi rigs so //
translated: how could suffering be created by another?🔽Here also, it is unreasonable that suffering is created by self and other.

original: gang gi phyir re zhig sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir re zhig sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Suffering is not self-created.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽gang gi phyir de nyid kyis de byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / gang gi phyir de nyid kyis de byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because it is not created by itself.

original: bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is contradictory for it to act on itself.

original: de'i phyir / bdag gis byas pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir / bdag gis byas pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: self-creation does not exist.

original: gzhan gyis byas pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, creation by another does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Why is it so?

original: byed po zhes bya bar brtags pa'i gzhan gang yin pa de nyid re zhig bdag gis ma byas shing bdag nyid kyis ma grub ste /
analyzed: byed po zhes bya bar brtags pa'i gzhan gang yin pa de nyid re zhig bdag gis ma byas shing bdag nyid kyis ma grub ste /
translated: That which is imagined as “another” who is the creator is not created by itself, and it is not established by itself.

original: de yang rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it depends on another cause.

original: gang zhig rang gi bdag nyid kyis grub pa ma yin pa de ni yod pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pas gzhan byed par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zhig rang gi bdag nyid kyis grub pa ma yin pa de ni yod pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pas gzhan byed par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: How could that which is not established by itself become another creator, since it has become an unreal nature?

original: 'di ni mi rigs so //🔽da ni sdug bsngal gnyis @80a * //
analyzed: 'di ni mi rigs so // da ni sdug bsngal gnyis @80a * //
translated: This is unreasonable.🔽Now, creation by both is also not possible.

original: kas byas pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: kas byas pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated in the line:

original: gal te re res byas gyur na //
analyzed: gal te re res byas gyur na //
translated: If each were to create it,

original: sdug bsngal gnyi gas byas par 'gyur //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gnyi gas byas par 'gyur //
translated: suffering would be created by both.

original: gal te re res sdug bsngal byed par 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te re res sdug bsngal byed par 'gyur na ni /
translated: If each were to create suffering,

original: de'i tshe sdug bsngal gnyi gas byas pa yin na /
analyzed: de'i tshe sdug bsngal gnyi gas byas pa yin na /
translated: then suffering would be created by both.

original: de ni re res byas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni re res byas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But this is not created by each.

original: bshad zin pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad zin pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the faults already explained would ensue.

original: re res srog gcod pa ma byas par ni gnyi gas byas so zhes brjod pa ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: re res srog gcod pa ma byas par ni gnyi gas byas so zhes brjod pa ma mthong ngo //
translated: And we have never seen it said that “both of them did it” when each of them did not kill.

original: da ni sdug bsngal rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ji ltar med pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni sdug bsngal rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ji ltar med pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate how suffering that arises without a cause does not exist,

original: bdag gis ma byas gzhan ma byas //🔽sdug bsngal rgyu med ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag gis ma byas gzhan ma byas // sdug bsngal rgyu med ga la 'gyur //
translated: Suffering is not self-created, Nor is it created by another.🔽How could it arise without a cause?

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: Suffering is not self-created.

original: gzhan gyis ma byas pa /🔽gzhan gyis ma bskyed pa 'di la yod pas na /🔽gzhan gyis ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ma byas pa / gzhan gyis ma bskyed pa 'di la yod pas na / gzhan gyis ma byas pa'o //
translated: It is not created by another.🔽It is not created by both itself and another.

original: 'di la bdag gis ma byas pa yod pas na bdag gis ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la bdag gis ma byas pa yod pas na bdag gis ma byas pa'o //
translated: It is not created by a creator other than itself.

original: gal te ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa med cing /
analyzed: gal te ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa med cing /
translated: If suffering is not self-created in the manner explained,

original: gzhan gyis byas pa yang med pa de'i tshe rgyu med pa yod par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa yang med pa de'i tshe rgyu med pa yod par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: and if it is not created by another, how could it arise without a cause?

original: nam mkha'i me tog gi dri zhim po bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog gi dri zhim po bzhin no //
translated: It would be like the sweet fragrance of a sky flower.

original: sdug bsngal med pa'i phyir na de'i rten du gyur pa'i bdag kyang lta ga la yod /
analyzed: sdug bsngal med pa'i phyir na de'i rten du gyur pa'i bdag kyang lta ga la yod /
translated: Since suffering does not exist, how could the self that is its basis exist?

original: ji ltar rnam pa bzhir dpyad na sdug bsngal yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa bzhir dpyad na sdug bsngal yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as suffering does not exist when analyzed in these four ways,

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po sa bon dang myu gu dang bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dag kyang rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /🔽sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po sa bon dang myu gu dang bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dag kyang rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir / sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig rnam pa bzhi //
translated: so external things such as seeds, sprouts, pots, cloth, and so on should be understood in the same way.🔽To demonstrate this, the text says:

original: yod ma yin pa ma yin gyi //
analyzed: yod ma yin pa ma yin gyi //
translated: Not only does suffering not exist in these four ways,

original: dngos po thams cad dag la yang //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad dag la yang //
translated: but also all things

original: rnam pa bzhi po yod ma yin //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po yod ma yin // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: do not exist in these four ways.

original: thams cad snga ma bzhin sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad snga ma bzhin sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: All should be applied as in the previous case.

original: gal te sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'di dag la rnam pa bzhi po med na /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'di dag la rnam pa bzhi po med na /
translated: If these such as suffering do not exist in these four ways,

original: 'o na da ni 'di dag rnam pa gang gis 'grub ce na /
analyzed: 'o na da ni 'di dag rnam pa gang gis 'grub ce na /
translated: then in what way do they exist?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We respond:

original: gal te sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'di dag rang bzhin gyis yod par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'di dag rang bzhin gyis yod par gyur na ni /
translated: If these such as suffering existed essentially,

original: nges par rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag las gang yang rung ba zhig gis 'grub par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: nges par rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag las gang yang rung ba zhig gis 'grub par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: It must be established by one of these four alternatives.

original: yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not.

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal la sogs pa dag rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin par nges so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal la sogs pa dag rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin par nges so //
translated: Therefore, it is certain that suffering and so on do not exist intrinsically.

original: 'on te phyin ci log tsam gyi bdag nyid yod par rnyed pa /
analyzed: 'on te phyin ci log tsam gyi bdag nyid yod par rnyed pa /
translated: But if you find that they exist only in the nature of error,

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa kun rdzob la rten cing 'brel par @80b 'byung ba'i rnam par gzhag pa tshol na ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa kun rdzob la rten cing 'brel par @80b 'byung ba'i rnam par gzhag pa tshol na ni /
translated: and you seek the conventional presentation of dependent origination in terms of suffering and so on,

original: de'i tshe las dang byed pa po brtags pa'i rab tu byed par bshad pa'i rnam pas ji skad smras pa'i phyogs bzhi bsal nas rkyen nyid 'di pa tsam gyi don gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba grub par khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe las dang byed pa po brtags pa'i rab tu byed par bshad pa'i rnam pas ji skad smras pa'i phyogs bzhi bsal nas rkyen nyid 'di pa tsam gyi don gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba grub par khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: then at that time, you should accept the establishment of the meaning of mere conditionality, dependent origination, by way of the explanation in the chapter “Examination of Action and Agent” of the refutation of the four alternatives.

original: ji skad du /🔽sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa dang / gzhan gyis byas dang gnyi gas byas //
analyzed: ji skad du / sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa dang / gzhan gyis byas dang gnyi gas byas //
translated: As it has been said:🔽The proponents of tenets imagine that suffering is self-created,

original: rgyu med rtog ge ba yis 'dod //
analyzed: rgyu med rtog ge ba yis 'dod //
translated: Created by another, created by both, or without a cause.

original: khyod kyis brten nas 'byung bar gsungs //
analyzed: khyod kyis brten nas 'byung bar gsungs //
translated: You taught dependent origination.🔽

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: You have taught that things arise dependently.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
translated: The Blessed One has also said:

original: kun rdzob tu ni rgyal bas chos bshad de //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni rgyal bas chos bshad de //
translated: The Victor taught the Dharma conventionally,

original: 'dus byas 'dus ma byas yin de ltar ltos /
analyzed: 'dus byas 'dus ma byas yin de ltar ltos /
translated: saying, “View it as conditioned and unconditioned.”

original: yang dag nyid du bdag dang bdag med de //
analyzed: yang dag nyid du bdag dang bdag med de //
translated: In reality, there is neither self nor non-self.

original: 'gro ba kun gyi mtshan nyid 'di 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba kun gyi mtshan nyid 'di 'dra'o //
translated: This is the nature of all beings.

original: dge dang nag po'i las rnams mi 'jig ste //
analyzed: dge dang nag po'i las rnams mi 'jig ste //
translated: Virtuous and non-virtuous actions are not destroyed.

original: bdag gis byas pa bdag ni myong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag gis byas pa bdag ni myong bar 'gyur //
translated: One experiences what one has done oneself.

original: las kyi 'bras bu 'pho bar mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu 'pho bar mi 'gyur te //
translated: The results of actions are not transferred to another.

original: rgyu med par yang myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu med par yang myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They are not experienced without a cause.

original: srid pa thams cad sgyu ma dbang med pa ;🔽/ gsog dang gsob tu gyur pa dbu ba bzhin /
analyzed: srid pa thams cad sgyu ma dbang med pa ; / gsog dang gsob tu gyur pa dbu ba bzhin /
translated: All existences are like illusions, powerless,🔽hollow and false, like foam.

original: sgyu ma smig rgyu lta bur rtag tu stong //
analyzed: sgyu ma smig rgyu lta bur rtag tu stong //
translated: They are always empty, like illusions and mirages.

original: sgra yis bshad kyang de dag dben pa yin //🔽brag phug ri dang gcong rong klung rnams su //
analyzed: sgra yis bshad kyang de dag dben pa yin // brag phug ri dang gcong rong klung rnams su //
translated: Though explained by words, they are void.🔽Just as an echo arises in caves, mountains, and ravines

original: rkyen gyis ji ltar brag ca 'byung ba ltar //
analyzed: rkyen gyis ji ltar brag ca 'byung ba ltar //
translated: due to conditions,

original: de bzhin 'dus byas 'di kun rig par gyis //
analyzed: de bzhin 'dus byas 'di kun rig par gyis //
translated: Likewise, understand that all conditioned things are like that.

original: 'gro ba thams cad sgyu ma smig rgyu bzhin //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad sgyu ma smig rgyu bzhin //
translated: All beings are like illusions and mirages.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas sbyar ba'i tshig gsal ba las /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas sbyar ba'i tshig gsal ba las /
translated: Thus it is said.🔽This is the commentary on the twelfth chapter, having twelve verses, called

original: bdag gis byas pa dang gzhan gyis byas pa brtag pa zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa bcu gnyis pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: bdag gis byas pa dang gzhan gyis byas pa brtag pa zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa bcu gnyis pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: “the examination of self-production and other-production.”🔽 Chapter XIII🔽Examination of the Prior Entity

original: // / gang gi phyir de ltar rab tu byed pa thal ma thag pa'i tshul gyis rnam par dpyad pa na /
analyzed: // / gang gi phyir de ltar rab tu byed pa thal ma thag pa'i tshul gyis rnam par dpyad pa na /
translated: Translation:  Thus, understand that all conditioned things are like that.🔽All beings are like illusions and mirages.🔽Thus it is said.🔽This is the commentary on the twelfth chapter, having twelve verses, called🔽“the examination of self-production and other-production.”🔽 Chapter XIII

original: dngos po rnams la bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi gas byas pa dang / rgyu med pa las byung ba nyid med cing skyed bar byed pa'i rnam pa gzhan yang med la /🔽ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis blo gros kyi mig nyams par byas pa rnams la dngos po 'di dag skye ba'i ngo bor yang snang ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po rnams la bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi gas byas pa dang / rgyu med pa las byung ba nyid med cing skyed bar byed pa'i rnam pa gzhan yang med la /🔽ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis blo gros kyi mig nyams par byas pa rnams la dngos po 'di dag skye ba'i ngo bor yang snang ba de'i phyir /
translated: Examination of the Prior Entity

original: rang bzhin med pa nyid du gyur pa na sgyu ma'i rta dang glang po che la sogs pas /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa nyid du gyur pa na sgyu ma'i rta dang glang po che la sogs pas /
translated: When they are devoid of intrinsic reality, then like the illusory horses and elephants,

original: de mi shes pa rnams ltar byis pa rnams slu bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de mi shes pa rnams ltar byis pa rnams slu bar byed pa yin no //
translated: they deceive the childish, who do not understand them.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: blo'i sbyin chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin lkog tu ma gyur pa mnga' ba /
analyzed: blo'i sbyin chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin lkog tu ma gyur pa mnga' ba /
translated: the Buddha Bhagavān, who possesses the gift of wisdom, who has the nature of all phenomena free from concealment,
who has

original: rig pa'i bag chags ma lus par drungs phyung ba /
analyzed: rig pa'i bag chags ma lus par drungs phyung ba /
translated: completely uprooted the latent propensities of ignorance,

original: sems can phyin ci log bzhis phyin ci log tu gyur zhing skyabs med pa yongs su bskyab par mdzad pa'i slad du rang bzhin med pa phyin ci ma log par nye bar ston pa lhur mdzad pa /
analyzed: sems can phyin ci log bzhis phyin ci log tu gyur zhing skyabs med pa yongs su bskyab par mdzad pa'i slad du rang bzhin med pa phyin ci ma log par nye bar ston pa lhur mdzad pa /
translated: who is intent on teaching the nonerroneous absence of intrinsic reality in order to protect sentient beings who are without refuge and who have become erroneous through the four errors,

original: thugs rje chen po'i mnga' ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos gang zhig / slu ba de ni brdzun zhes gsungs //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po'i mnga' ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos gang zhig / slu ba de ni brdzun zhes gsungs //
translated: the Buddha Bhagavān, who possesses great compassion, has said that any phenomenon that is deceptive is false.

original: 'du byed thams cad slu ba'i chos //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad slu ba'i chos //
translated: All compounded phenomena are deceptive phenomena.

original: des na de dag brdzun pa yin //
analyzed: des na de dag brdzun pa yin //
translated: Therefore they are false.

original: mdo las dge slong dag 'dus byas slu ba'i chos can gang yin pa de ni brdzun pa yin la /
analyzed: mdo las dge slong dag 'dus byas slu ba'i chos can gang yin pa de ni brdzun pa yin la /
translated: Monks, that which is a conditioned thing is a deceptive phenomenon, and that which is a deceptive phenomenon is false.🔽That which is a nondeceptive phenomenon is nirvana, and that which is a nondeceptive phenomenon is the highest truth.

original: mi slu ba'i chos can mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa de ni bden pa dam pa'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du 'di ni slu bar byed pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: mi slu ba'i chos can mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa de ni bden pa dam pa'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du 'di ni slu bar byed pa'i chos can no //
translated: Similarly, it is said: This is a deceptive phenomenon.

original: 'di ni 'jig pa'i chos can no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig pa'i chos can no zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is a phenomenon that perishes.

original: de'i phyir tshul 'dis gang su zhing 'jig pa'i chos can de ni brdzun pa yin no zhes de skad du /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshul 'dis gang su zhing 'jig pa'i chos can de ni brdzun pa yin no zhes de skad du /
translated: Therefore, by this method, whatever is a phenomenon that perishes is false.🔽Thus the Bhagavan, the Tathagata, has said:

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa dang / 'du byed thams cad kyang slu ba'i chos can yin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa dang / 'du byed thams cad kyang slu ba'i chos can yin pas de'i phyir /
translated: All compounded phenomena are deceptive phenomena. Therefore,

original: 'du byed de dag slu ba'i chos can yin pas brdzun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du byed de dag slu ba'i chos can yin pas brdzun par 'gyur ro //
translated: because those compounded phenomena are deceptive phenomena, they are false.

original: de la slu ba'i chos can ni 'drid par byed cing phyin ci log tu snang ba ste /
analyzed: de la slu ba'i chos can ni 'drid par byed cing phyin ci log tu snang ba ste /
translated: In this context, a deceptive phenomenon is that which deceives by appearing in a way that is not its real nature,

original: mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin no //
analyzed: mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin no //
translated: like the circle of a whirling firebrand.

original: de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid kyis na 'du byed thams cad brdzun pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid kyis na 'du byed thams cad brdzun pa ste /
translated: Since they are not of that nature, all compounded phenomena are false,

original: slu ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: slu ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are deceptive phenomena.

original: smig rgyu'i chu bzhin no /
analyzed: smig rgyu'i chu bzhin no /
translated: They are like a mirage’s water.

original: gang zhig bden pa de ni slu ba'i chos can ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig bden pa de ni slu ba'i chos can ma yin te /
translated: Whatever is true is not a deceptive phenomenon.

original: dper na mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, nirvana is.

original: de'i phyir / bstan pa'i rigs pa dang lung 'di las /
analyzed: de'i phyir / bstan pa'i rigs pa dang lung 'di las /
translated: Therefore, by this reasoning and scripture that is taught,

original: dngos po rnams rang bzhin med par grub ste /
analyzed: dngos po rnams rang bzhin med par grub ste /
translated: things are established as essenceless.🔽Because it says in the Perfection of Wisdom:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las chos thams cad ni stong pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las chos thams cad ni stong pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are empty,

original: rang bzhin med pa'i tshul gyis so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i tshul gyis so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are essenceless.

original: 'dir smras pa /🔽gal te de ltar slu ba'i chos can nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / gal te de ltar slu ba'i chos can nyid kyis /
translated: Here, someone might say,🔽“If, in this way, all compounded phenomena are shown to be false

original: 'du byed thams cad brdzun pa nyid du bstan na /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad brdzun pa nyid du bstan na /
translated: by the fact that they are deceptive phenomena,

original: de lta na ni dngos po thams cad med pas dngos po thams cad la skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni dngos po thams cad med pas dngos po thams cad la skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then since all things would be nonexistent, you would have a nihilistic view that denies all things.”

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: gang dag da dung du yang khyod slu bar byed pa slu ba'i chos can dag yod pa 'di ni bden no //🔽gal te slu chos gang yin pa //
analyzed: gang dag da dung du yang khyod slu bar byed pa slu ba'i chos can dag yod pa 'di ni bden no // gal te slu chos gang yin pa //
translated: It is true that there are deceptive phenomena that still deceive you.🔽If that which is deceptive

original: de brdzun de la ci zhig slu //
analyzed: de brdzun de la ci zhig slu //
translated: is false, what is there to deceive?

original: ma yin nam /
analyzed: ma yin nam /
translated: Isn’t it so?

original: gang gi tshe kho bo cag gi slu ba can gang yin pa de ni brdzun pa'o @81b zhes bshad pa de'i tshe de la ci zhig slu ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe kho bo cag gi slu ba can gang yin pa de ni brdzun pa'o @81b zhes bshad pa de'i tshe de la ci zhig slu ste /
translated: When we say that that which is deceptive is false, then what is there to deceive?

original: de la ci zhig dngos po med par 'gyur //
analyzed: de la ci zhig dngos po med par 'gyur //
translated: What is there that would become a nonthing?

original: gal te dngos po 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te dngos po 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na ni /
translated: If some thing existed,

original: de la skur pa btab pas med par lta ba'i log par lta bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de la skur pa btab pas med par lta ba'i log par lta bar 'gyur na /
translated: then because of the denial of it, the view of nonexistence would be a wrong view.

original: gang gi tshe dngos po cung zad kyang ma mthong ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dngos po cung zad kyang ma mthong ba de'i tshe /
translated: But when you do not see anything at all,

original: der ci zhig slu bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: der ci zhig slu bar 'gyur te /
translated: then what is there to deceive?

original: 'ga' yang dngos po med par mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: 'ga' yang dngos po med par mi 'gyur bas /
translated: Nothing at all would become a nonthing.

original: khyod kyis glan ka 'di ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: khyod kyis glan ka 'di ni mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, this criticism of yours is not correct.

original: 'dir gal te dngos po med pa'i lta ba yang mi ston na /
analyzed: 'dir gal te dngos po med pa'i lta ba yang mi ston na /
translated: If you do not teach the view of nonexistence,

original: lung 'dis ci zhig ston /
analyzed: lung 'dis ci zhig ston /
translated: what does this scripture teach?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: I will explain.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de gsungs pa //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de gsungs pa //
translated: The Lord taught that

original: stong nyid yongs su bstan pa yin //
analyzed: stong nyid yongs su bstan pa yin //
translated: emptiness is the complete teaching.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad bstan pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med par ston pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad bstan pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med par ston pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The Lord taught that which is called “emptiness” is not a teaching of non-entityness.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: stong pa nyid yongs su ston pa yin te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid yongs su ston pa yin te /
translated: It is the complete teaching of emptiness.

original: rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa'i yongs su gsal bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa'i yongs su gsal bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the complete teaching of non-production by intrinsic nature.

original: ji skad du mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las /
translated: As a sūtra says:

original: gang zhig rkyen las skyes pa de ma skyes //
analyzed: gang zhig rkyen las skyes pa de ma skyes //
translated: Whatever is produced from conditions is not produced.

original: de la skye ba'i rang bzhin yod ma yin //
analyzed: de la skye ba'i rang bzhin yod ma yin //
translated: It does not have the nature of production.

original: rkyen la rag las gang de stong par bshad //
analyzed: rkyen la rag las gang de stong par bshad //
translated: Whatever depends on the aggregation of causes and conditions is explained to be empty.

original: gang zhig stong nyid shes de bag yod min //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang zhig stong nyid shes de bag yod min // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Those who know emptiness are not heedless.

original: 'dir lung gis dngos po'i rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa yongs su gsal bar byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir lung gis dngos po'i rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa yongs su gsal bar byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Here, the sūtra does not clarify non-production by virtue of intrinsic nature.

original: 'on te ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ci zhe na /
translated: What does it clarify?

original: rang bzhin med pa ste rang bzhin mi gnas pa nyid dang / 'jig pa nyid ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa ste rang bzhin mi gnas pa nyid dang / 'jig pa nyid ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: It shows that things lack intrinsic reality, that is, that they do not endure intrinsically, and that they are perishable.

original: 'di gang las she na /
analyzed: 'di gang las she na /
translated: From what does this follow?

original: dngos rnams ngo bo nyid med de //
analyzed: dngos rnams ngo bo nyid med de //
translated: Things do not have intrinsic reality,

original: gzhan du 'gyur bar snang phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur bar snang phyir ro //
translated: because they are seen to change.

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba ste /
translated: They change,🔽because they are seen to transform.

original: yongs su 'gyur ba mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what it means.

original: 'di skad du gal te /
analyzed: 'di skad du gal te /
translated: It would be as if someone said:

original: dngos po rnams la rang bzhin med na /
analyzed: dngos po rnams la rang bzhin med na /
translated: If things do not have intrinsic reality,

original: de'i tshe 'di dag gzhan du 'gyur ba dmigs par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di dag gzhan du 'gyur ba dmigs par mi 'gyur na /
translated: then it would not be perceived that they change.

original: yongs su 'gyur ba ni dmigs pa yang yin te /
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba ni dmigs pa yang yin te /
translated: But transformation is perceived.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin mi gnas pa nyid mdo'i don yin par shes par bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin mi gnas pa nyid mdo'i don yin par shes par bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the meaning of the sutra is that things do not endure intrinsically.

original: 'di'i phyir yang de ni de ltar yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i phyir yang de ni de ltar yin te /
translated: This is also the case for the following reason.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: dngos po ngo bo nyid med de //
analyzed: dngos po ngo bo nyid med de //
translated: Things do not have intrinsic reality,

original: gang phyir dngos rnams stong pa nyid //
analyzed: gang phyir dngos rnams stong pa nyid //
translated: because things are empty.

original: 'di ltar dngos po gang zhig ngo bo nyid med pa de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po gang zhig ngo bo nyid med pa de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In that case, any thing that lacks intrinsic reality does not exist.

original: dngos po rnams kyi chos stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi chos stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'dod pa yin no //
translated: It is accepted that the emptiness of things is called “emptiness.”

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i mo gsham gyi bu la /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i mo gsham gyi bu la /
translated: It is not tenable that the son of a barren woman, who does not exist,

original: de'i sngo bsangs nyid mi 'thad pas chos can med pas /🔽de la @82a * //
analyzed: de'i sngo bsangs nyid mi 'thad pas chos can med pas / de la @82a * //
translated: has blueness. Therefore, since the basis of emptiness does not exist,🔽the emptiness that is based on it is not tenable.

original: brten pa'i chos kyang mi 'thad pa de'i phyir dngos po rnams rang bzhin yod pa yin no //
analyzed: brten pa'i chos kyang mi 'thad pa de'i phyir dngos po rnams rang bzhin yod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, things do exist essentially.

original: gzhan yang / gal te ngo bo nyid med na /
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te ngo bo nyid med na /
translated: Moreover, if they lack intrinsic reality,

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba gang gi yin //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba gang gi yin //
translated: whose transformation would it be?

original: gal te dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin med na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin med na /
translated: If things lack intrinsic reality,

original: yongs su 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi gzhan du 'gyur ba gang yin pa de gang gi yin par 'gyur zhes 'dzer to //
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi gzhan du 'gyur ba gang yin pa de gang gi yin par 'gyur zhes 'dzer to //
translated: whose transformation would it be? It would be the transformation of that which has the characteristic of complete transformation.

original: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here we say:

original: de ltar yongs su btags kyang /
analyzed: de ltar yongs su btags kyang /
translated: Even though it is imputed in this way,

original: gal te ngo bo nyid yod na /
analyzed: gal te ngo bo nyid yod na /
translated: if it has intrinsic reality,

original: ji lta bur na gzhan du 'gyur /
analyzed: ji lta bur na gzhan du 'gyur /
translated: how could it transform?

original: 'dir chos gang zhig dngos po gang la mi 'khrul pa de na de'i rang bzhin zhes bsnyad de /
analyzed: 'dir chos gang zhig dngos po gang la mi 'khrul pa de na de'i rang bzhin zhes bsnyad de /
translated: Here, any phenomenon that is nondeceptive with regard to any object is called its intrinsic reality.

original: gzhan gyis gegs byar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gegs byar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it cannot be obstructed by anything else.

original: de la mi 'khrul pa'i me'i tsha ba la ni 'jig rten na rang bzhin zhes brjod la /
analyzed: de la mi 'khrul pa'i me'i tsha ba la ni 'jig rten na rang bzhin zhes brjod la /
translated: In the world, the heat of fire is called its intrinsic reality.

original: tsha ba de nyid chu dag la dmigs pa na rkyen gzhan las byung bas bcos ma yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin ma yin no //🔽gang gi tshe /
analyzed: tsha ba de nyid chu dag la dmigs pa na rkyen gzhan las byung bas bcos ma yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin ma yin no // gang gi tshe /
translated: But when that heat is observed in water, it is not intrinsic because it arises from other conditions and is therefore fabricated.

original: de ltar rang bzhin ni 'khrul pa med par 'gyur ba yin par bya dgos pa de'i tshe 'khrul pa med pas gzhan du 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin ni 'khrul pa med par 'gyur ba yin par bya dgos pa de'i tshe 'khrul pa med pas gzhan du 'gyur ba med de /
translated: When intrinsic reality must be taken to be nondeceptive, then because it is nondeceptive, it does not change into something else.

original: me ni grang bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: me ni grang bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Fire does not become cold.

original: de bzhin du dngos po rnams la yang rang bzhin khas lan na gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po rnams la yang rang bzhin khas lan na gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med par 'gyur na /
translated: In the same way, if you assert that things have intrinsic reality, then they would not change into something else.

original: de dag ni gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid du dmigs pa yang yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid du dmigs pa yang yin te /
translated: But they are observed to change into something else.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, intrinsic reality does not exist.

original: gzhan yang gang zhig snang ba las rang bzhin dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ba gzhan du gyur pa 'di ni dngos po rnams la mi srid pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan yang gang zhig snang ba las rang bzhin dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ba gzhan du gyur pa 'di ni dngos po rnams la mi srid pa nyid do //
translated: Moreover, it is impossible for things to have an intrinsic reality that would transform into something else.

original: ji ltar mi srid pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir /🔽de nyid la ni gzhan 'gyur med //
analyzed: ji ltar mi srid pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir / de nyid la ni gzhan 'gyur med //
translated: In order to demonstrate how that is impossible, he said:🔽There is no transformation of that itself.

original: gzhan nyid la yang yod ma yin //🔽gang phyir gzhon nu mi rga ste //
analyzed: gzhan nyid la yang yod ma yin // gang phyir gzhon nu mi rga ste //
translated: Nor is there transformation of something else.🔽Because a youth does not age,

original: gang phyir rgas pa'ang mi rga'o //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gang phyir rgas pa'ang mi rga'o // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
