translated: and because an old person does not age.

original: re zhig dngos po sngar gyi gnas skabs na gnas pa de nyid ni gzhan du 'gyur bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: re zhig dngos po sngar gyi gnas skabs na gnas pa de nyid ni gzhan du 'gyur bar mi 'thad do //
translated: First, it is not tenable that that very thing that exists in a prior state transforms into something else.

original: 'di ltar lang tsho'i gnas skabs nyid la gnas pa'i gzhon nu la ni gzhan du 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar lang tsho'i gnas skabs nyid la gnas pa'i gzhon nu la ni gzhan du 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, a youth who exists in the state of youth does not have transformation.

original: ci ste gnas skabs gzhan thob pa nyid la gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid rtog na /
analyzed: ci ste gnas skabs gzhan thob pa nyid la gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid rtog na /
translated: But if you imagine that transformation into something else occurs when a different state is attained,

original: de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: that also is untenable.

original: gzhan du gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rgas pa'i rnam grangs yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rgas pa'i rnam grangs yin te /
translated: “ Transformation” is a synonym for aging.

original: de gal te gzhon nu la mi 'dod kyi gzhan rgas pa kho na la 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: de gal te gzhon nu la mi 'dod kyi gzhan rgas pa kho na la 'gyur na ni /
translated: If aging does not occur in the youth, but only in another,

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: then that is also illogical.

original: gang gi phyir rgas pa la ni yang rga ba dang / 'grel ba dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgas pa la ni yang rga ba dang / 'grel ba dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no need for aging to occur in the aged.

original: rgas @82b pa la yang rga ba dang 'brel pas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: rgas @82b pa la yang rga ba dang 'brel pas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: What would be the point of aging occurring in the aged?

original: de med par yang rgas pa nyid yod pas rgas pa rga'o zhes bya ba ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: de med par yang rgas pa nyid yod pas rgas pa rga'o zhes bya ba ni mi rigs so //
translated: Since aging would exist even without aging, it is illogical to say “The aged age.”

original: ci ste gzhon nu nyid gzhan du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste gzhon nu nyid gzhan du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if you think that the youth itself becomes another,

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: that is illogical.

original: rgas pa'i gnas skabs ma thob pa la gzhon nu zhes brjod pa'i phyir dang / gnas skabs gnyis kyang phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgas pa'i gnas skabs ma thob pa la gzhon nu zhes brjod pa'i phyir dang / gnas skabs gnyis kyang phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one who has not attained the state of being aged is called “youth,” and because the two states are mutually exclusive.🔽Moreover,

original: gzhan yang // gal te de nyid gzhan 'gyur na //
analyzed: gzhan yang // gal te de nyid gzhan 'gyur na //
translated: If that itself becomes another,

original: 'o ma nyid ni zhor 'gyur ro //🔽ci ste 'o ma'i gnas skabs btang nas /
analyzed: 'o ma nyid ni zhor 'gyur ro // ci ste 'o ma'i gnas skabs btang nas /
translated: then milk itself would become curd.🔽But if you think that because milk abandons the state of being milk

original: zho'i gnas skabs su gyur pa de'i phyir 'o ma nyid zhor 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: zho'i gnas skabs su gyur pa de'i phyir 'o ma nyid zhor 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: and attains the state of being curd, therefore milk itself becomes curd,🔽then that is illogical.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We will respond to that.

original: gal te phan tshun 'gal bas 'o ma nyid zhor 'gyur ro zhes bya bar mi 'dod na ni /
analyzed: gal te phan tshun 'gal bas 'o ma nyid zhor 'gyur ro zhes bya bar mi 'dod na ni /
translated: If you do not accept that milk itself becomes curd because they are mutually exclusive,🔽then what else

original: 'o ma las gzhan gang zhig ni //🔽zho yi dngos po yin par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'o ma las gzhan gang zhig ni // zho yi dngos po yin par 'gyur //
translated: other than milk🔽could be the entity of curd?

original: ci chu zho'i dngos por 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ci chu zho'i dngos por 'gyur ram /
translated: What else could be the entity of curd?

original: de'i phyir gzhan zho'i dngos por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni ma 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan zho'i dngos por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni ma 'brel pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this statement “It becomes curd” is incoherent.

original: de'i phyir / de ltar gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir de snang ba las dngos po rnams rang bzhin dang bcas par 'grub par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de ltar gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir de snang ba las dngos po rnams rang bzhin dang bcas par 'grub par ga la 'gyur /
translated: Thus, because it does not become something else, how could it be established that things have essence due to appearance?

original: de'i phyir 'di ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore this is not reasonable.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:🔽In the noble Jewel Cloud Sūtra, it says:

original: 'phags pa dkon mchog 'byung gnas zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo las /🔽chos gang skye ba med cing 'byung ba med //
analyzed: 'phags pa dkon mchog 'byung gnas zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo las / chos gang skye ba med cing 'byung ba med //
translated: The lion among men taught that🔽no phenomenon arises or ceases,🔽is tainted or unstained,

original: 'chi 'pho med cing rga bar mi 'gyur ba //🔽mi yi seng ge yis ni der bstan zhing //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho med cing rga bar mi 'gyur ba // mi yi seng ge yis ni der bstan zhing //
translated: is produced or stopped,🔽is enhanced or diminished,🔽is increased or decreased.

original: sems can brgya phrag dag ni de la bkod //
analyzed: sems can brgya phrag dag ni de la bkod //
translated: He placed hundreds of sentient beings in that.

original: gang la'ang ngo bo nyid ni gang yang med //
analyzed: gang la'ang ngo bo nyid ni gang yang med //
translated: There is no essence whatsoever in anything.

original: gzhan yang ma yin sus kyang mi rnyed pa //
analyzed: gzhan yang ma yin sus kyang mi rnyed pa //
translated: It is not other, and no one can find it.

original: nang na ma yin phyi rol dag na yang //
analyzed: nang na ma yin phyi rol dag na yang //
translated: It is not within, nor is it without.

original: mi rnyed de dag la ni mgon pos bkod //
analyzed: mi rnyed de dag la ni mgon pos bkod //
translated: The Protector has taught that it cannot be found.

original: bde bar gshegs pas zhi pa'i 'gro gsungs kyang //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pas zhi pa'i 'gro gsungs kyang //
translated: The Sugata has taught that beings are peaceful,

original: 'gro ba gang yang rnyed par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'gro ba gang yang rnyed par mi 'gyur te //
translated: But no being can be found.

original: de dag 'gro las grol bar rnam par gsungs //
analyzed: de dag 'gro las grol bar rnam par gsungs //
translated: He has taught that they are free from wandering,

original: grol nas sems can mang po grol bar mdzad //
analyzed: grol nas sems can mang po grol bar mdzad //
translated: And, having been liberated, he liberates many beings.

original: bdag med par ni chos kun ston mdzad cing //
analyzed: bdag med par ni chos kun ston mdzad cing //
translated: He has taught that all phenomena are selfless,

original: sems can 'dzin las 'jig rten rnam par grol //
analyzed: sems can 'dzin las 'jig rten rnam par grol //
translated: And the world is liberated from grasping at beings.

original: bdag nyid 'gro las grol zhing 'gro grol bas //
analyzed: bdag nyid 'gro las grol zhing 'gro grol bas //
translated: He himself is liberated from wandering, and he liberates wandering beings.

original: de bzhin pha rol gshegs kyang rgal ba'ang med ;
analyzed: de bzhin pha rol gshegs kyang rgal ba'ang med ;
translated: Thus, he has gone beyond, but there is no one who has crossed over.

original: ; drang srong chen po srid pa'i pha rol phyin //
analyzed: ; drang srong chen po srid pa'i pha rol phyin //
translated: The Great Sage has gone beyond existence,

original: pha rol gshegs pa gang yang mi rnyed 'gyur //
analyzed: pha rol gshegs pa gang yang mi rnyed 'gyur //
translated: But no one can be found who has gone beyond.

original: pha rol yod ma yin zhing tshu rol med //
analyzed: pha rol yod ma yin zhing tshu rol med //
translated: There is no beyond, and there is no near side.

original: pha rol song ngo zhes kyang tshig tu gsung //
analyzed: pha rol song ngo zhes kyang tshig tu gsung //
translated: He has taught the words, “Go beyond!”

original: gang gis tshig tu smra ba de yang med //
analyzed: gang gis tshig tu smra ba de yang med //
translated: There is no one who speaks in words.

original: gang smras de yi tshig kyang yod ma yin //🔽gang la smra ba de yang rnyed mi @83a * //
analyzed: gang smras de yi tshig kyang yod ma yin // gang la smra ba de yang rnyed mi @83a * //
translated: There are no words that are spoken.🔽There is no one who understands.

original: 'gyur // gang gis shes pa de yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'gyur // gang gis shes pa de yang yod ma yin //
translated: There is no one who is understood.

original: log par rtog la chags pa'i dbang gis su //
analyzed: log par rtog la chags pa'i dbang gis su //
translated: Through the power of attachment to false conceptions,

original: 'dir ni 'gro ba 'di kun rab tu 'khyams //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'gro ba 'di kun rab tu 'khyams //
translated: all these beings wander here.

original: skyes bu gang zhig zhi ba'i chos rig pa //
analyzed: skyes bu gang zhig zhi ba'i chos rig pa //
translated: The person who knows the peaceful Dharma

original: des ni rang 'byung de bzhin gshegs pa mthong //
analyzed: des ni rang 'byung de bzhin gshegs pa mthong //
translated: sees the self-arisen Thus-Gone One.

original: chos mchog zhi ba rnams kyang rab tu shes //
analyzed: chos mchog zhi ba rnams kyang rab tu shes //
translated: They also know the peaceful supreme Dharma,

original: dga' ba rnyed nas sems can tshim par byed //
analyzed: dga' ba rnyed nas sems can tshim par byed //
translated: and having found joy, they satisfy beings.

original: nyon mongs rgyal nas de nyid rgyal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: nyon mongs rgyal nas de nyid rgyal bar 'gyur //
translated: Having conquered the afflictions, they become victorious.

original: bdag nyid rgyal bar gyur zhing gnas pa med //
analyzed: bdag nyid rgyal bar gyur zhing gnas pa med //
translated: Having become victorious, they abide without abiding.

original: de phyir rgyal ba'i byang chub rab tu mkhyen //
analyzed: de phyir rgyal ba'i byang chub rab tu mkhyen //
translated: Therefore, the Victorious One fully knows awakening.

original: sangs rgyas nas ni 'gro ba shes par byed //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nas ni 'gro ba shes par byed //
translated: Having become a Buddha, he causes beings to understand.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: And so on.

original: dngos po ngo bo nyid med pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po ngo bo nyid med pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Things that lack intrinsic reality do not exist.

original: dngos po rnams stong pa nyid du ni 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnams stong pa nyid du ni 'dod pa yin no //
translated: It is maintained that things are empty.

original: de'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi rten du gyur pa dngos po'i rang bzhin yod do zhes bya ba gang yin pa de dag mi rigs so zhes gsungs pa //
analyzed: de'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi rten du gyur pa dngos po'i rang bzhin yod do zhes bya ba gang yin pa de dag mi rigs so zhes gsungs pa //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable to say that the intrinsic reality of things exists as the basis of emptiness.

original: gal te stong min cung zad yod //
analyzed: gal te stong min cung zad yod //
translated: If something were not empty,

original: stong pa'ang cung zad yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa'ang cung zad yod par 'gyur //
translated: then emptiness would exist.

original: mi stong cung zad yod min na //
analyzed: mi stong cung zad yod min na //
translated: But since nothing is not empty,

original: stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur //
translated: how could emptiness exist?

original: gal te stong pa nyid ces bya ba zhig 'ga' zhig tu yod na ni /
analyzed: gal te stong pa nyid ces bya ba zhig 'ga' zhig tu yod na ni /
translated: If something called “emptiness” existed in some way,

original: de'i tshe de'i rten dngos po'i rang bzhin yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i rten dngos po'i rang bzhin yod par 'gyur na /
translated: then at that time, the intrinsic reality of things that are its basis would exist.

original: de ltar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin no //
translated: But that is not the case.

original: 'dir stong pa nyid dang bdag med pa nyid dag ni chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes khas blangs pas stong pa ma yin pa'i chos med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid ma yin pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir stong pa nyid dang bdag med pa nyid dag ni chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes khas blangs pas stong pa ma yin pa'i chos med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid ma yin pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Here, since it is accepted that emptiness and selflessness are the universal characteristics of all phenomena, there are no phenomena that are not empty, and therefore that which is not empty does not exist.

original: gang gi tshe stong pa ma yin pa'i dngos po med cing stong pa nyid ma yin pa yang yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe stong pa ma yin pa'i dngos po med cing stong pa nyid ma yin pa yang yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: When there are no things that are not empty, and that which is not emptiness does not exist,

original: gnyen po la ltos pa dang bral bas nam mkha'i me tog gi phreng ba ltar stong pa nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes nges par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyen po la ltos pa dang bral bas nam mkha'i me tog gi phreng ba ltar stong pa nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes nges par bya'o //
translated: then, since there is no dependence on an antidote, it should be ascertained that emptiness does not exist, like a garland of sky flowers.

original: gang gi tshe stong pa nyid yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe de'i rten dngos po yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe stong pa nyid yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe de'i rten dngos po yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: When emptiness does not exist, then its basis, things, do not exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here the opponent says:

original: gang bstan par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gang bstan par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Buddha, the Bhagavat, taught emptiness

original: 'gro ba mu stegs pa'i smra ba ma rig pa'i smag chen po'i rjes su son pa la /
analyzed: 'gro ba mu stegs pa'i smra ba ma rig pa'i smag chen po'i rjes su son pa la /
translated: in order to eliminate the world’s fear of selflessness.

original: 'gro ba'i sgron me gcig pur gyur pa /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i sgron me gcig pur gyur pa /
translated: They are the sole lamp for beings.

original: bdag med pa nye bar ston pa'i me lce rgyun mi chad pa mnga' ba rnams 'byung ba /
analyzed: bdag med pa nye bar ston pa'i me lce rgyun mi chad pa mnga' ba rnams 'byung ba /
translated: They possess the uninterrupted flame of the teaching of selflessness.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa zhes bya ba /
translated: The three doors of liberation are called emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul bya @83b rnams la rnam par grol bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa mu stegs pa'i gzhung lugs thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa dag ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul bya @83b rnams la rnam par grol bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa mu stegs pa'i gzhung lugs thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa dag ni /
translated: The Bhagavat taught them to his disciples in order to liberate them. They are not shared with any of the non-Buddhist systems.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung rab kho na la dmigs na /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung rab kho na la dmigs na /
translated: If one focuses on the scriptures of the Sugata alone,

original: khyod kyis ni da ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab rnam par 'chad pa'i rgyu thabs kyis stong pa nyid de spong bar brtsams pa yin pas /
analyzed: khyod kyis ni da ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab rnam par 'chad pa'i rgyu thabs kyis stong pa nyid de spong bar brtsams pa yin pas /
translated: you have begun to abandon emptiness by the method of the cause of explaining the scriptures of the Tathāgata.

original: mtho ris dang byang grol gyi lam rgyun gcod par byed pa khyod dang brtsad pas chog go //
analyzed: mtho ris dang byang grol gyi lam rgyun gcod par byed pa khyod dang brtsad pas chog go //
translated: Therefore, it is appropriate for me to debate with you, who cut the continuum of the path to the higher realms and liberation.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: ae ma kyi hud gnam du phyogs pa ltar shin tu phyin ci log tu gyur pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'gro ba'i lam zhi ba drang po bor nas /
analyzed: ae ma kyi hud gnam du phyogs pa ltar shin tu phyin ci log tu gyur pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'gro ba'i lam zhi ba drang po bor nas /
translated: Alas! You are so mistaken, like someone who has lost his way in the sky. You have abandoned the straight and peaceful path that leads to the city of nirvana.

original: dngos po la mngon par zhan pa'i sbrul gyis dkris pa /
analyzed: dngos po la mngon par zhan pa'i sbrul gyis dkris pa /
translated: You are bound by the snake of attachment to things.🔽You are on the path of the wilderness of samsara, and you are attached to the very things that prevent you from reaching the city of liberation.

original: 'khor ba'i dgon pa'i lam las thar pa'i grong khyer du 'gro ba nyid du rten pa khyod ni dam pa dag gis smad par bya ba yin bzhin du mngon pa'i nga rgyal zhen pas gzung ba'i dbang nyid kyis de dag nyid la smod par byed pa zhig ste
analyzed: 'khor ba'i dgon pa'i lam las thar pa'i grong khyer du 'gro ba nyid du rten pa khyod ni dam pa dag gis smad par bya ba yin bzhin du mngon pa'i nga rgyal zhen pas gzung ba'i dbang nyid kyis de dag nyid la smod par byed pa zhig ste
translated: You are despised by the holy ones, and yet, because of your pride and attachment, you are attached to them and you criticize those who criticize them.

original: / kva'i nyon mongs pa'i nad ma lus par gso bar mdzad pa /
analyzed: / kva'i nyon mongs pa'i nad ma lus par gso bar mdzad pa /
translated: O you who completely cure the disease of the afflictions,

original: sman pa'i rgyal po chen po ni //
analyzed: sman pa'i rgyal po chen po ni //
translated: great king of physicians,

original: rgyal ba rnams kyi stong pa nyid //
analyzed: rgyal ba rnams kyi stong pa nyid //
translated: the emptiness of the victors

original: lta kun nges par 'byung bar gsungs //
analyzed: lta kun nges par 'byung bar gsungs //
translated: is said to be the deliverance from all views.

original: gang dag stong pa nyid lta ba //
analyzed: gang dag stong pa nyid lta ba //
translated: Those who view emptiness

original: de dag sgrub tu med par gsungs //
analyzed: de dag sgrub tu med par gsungs //
translated: are said to be incurable.

original: ma yin nam /
analyzed: ma yin nam /
translated: Is this not so?

original: 'dir stong pa nyid ni 'di lta bar gyur pa thams cad kyi mngon par zhen pa thams cad nges par 'byung ba ste log pa gang yin pa de yin la /
analyzed: 'dir stong pa nyid ni 'di lta bar gyur pa thams cad kyi mngon par zhen pa thams cad nges par 'byung ba ste log pa gang yin pa de yin la /
translated: Here, emptiness is the definite emergence or cessation of all the views,

original: lta bar gyur pa rnams log pa tsam ni dngos po yang ma yin no //
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa rnams log pa tsam ni dngos po yang ma yin no //
translated: and the mere cessation of the views is not a thing.

original: gang dag stong pa nyid de la yang dngos por mngon par zhen pa de dag la ni kho bo cag mi smra ste /
analyzed: gang dag stong pa nyid de la yang dngos por mngon par zhen pa de dag la ni kho bo cag mi smra ste /
translated: We do not speak to those who cling to emptiness as a thing.

original: de'i phyir kho bo cag gis nye bar bstan pa las rtog pa mtha' dag logs na thar par 'gyur ba ga la yod /
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo cag gis nye bar bstan pa las rtog pa mtha' dag logs na thar par 'gyur ba ga la yod /
translated: Therefore, how could liberation be possible for those who imagine that our teachings are something other than the cessation of all views?

original: 'di ltar gang zhig la khyod la zong ci yang mi ster ro zhes smras pa dang / kye bdag la ci yang med pa zhes bya ba'i thong de nyid byin cig ces smra na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig la khyod la zong ci yang mi ster ro zhes smras pa dang / kye bdag la ci yang med pa zhes bya ba'i thong de nyid byin cig ces smra na /
translated: If someone says to you, “I will give you nothing at all,” and you reply, “Give me that ‘nothing at all,’”

original: de zong med par 'dzin du gzhug par thabs gang gis nus /
analyzed: de zong med par 'dzin du gzhug par thabs gang gis nus /
translated: how could you get that person to understand that you mean nothing at all?

original: de bzhin du gang dag stong pa nyid la yang mngon par zhen pa de dag gi de la dngos por mngon par zhen pa de gang gis 'gog par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang dag stong pa nyid la yang mngon par zhen pa de dag gi de la dngos por mngon par zhen pa de gang gis 'gog par 'gyur /
translated: Likewise, how could the conception of things as real in regard to emptiness be stopped for those who are attached to emptiness?

original: de'i phyir sman pa chen po la yang nyes pa'i 'du shes yod pa'i phyir gso bar mdzad pa'i mchog sman pa chen po de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis de dag bor ba nyid @84a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir sman pa chen po la yang nyes pa'i 'du shes yod pa'i phyir gso bar mdzad pa'i mchog sman pa chen po de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis de dag bor ba nyid @84a * //
translated: Therefore, because they have the idea that the great physician is at fault, the great physicians, the Tathagatas, the supreme healers, abandon them.

original: yin no // ji skad du 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i mdo las /🔽gang stong pa nyid kyis chos rnams stong par mi byed de /
analyzed: yin no // ji skad du 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i mdo las / gang stong pa nyid kyis chos rnams stong par mi byed de /
translated: As it says in the Holy Heap of Jewels:🔽Emptiness does not make things empty;🔽things are themselves empty.🔽Signlessness does not make things signless;

original: chos rnams nyid stong pa dang / gang mtshan ma med pas chos rnams mtshan ma med par mi byed de /
analyzed: chos rnams nyid stong pa dang / gang mtshan ma med pas chos rnams mtshan ma med par mi byed de /
translated: things are themselves signless.

original: chos rnams nyid mtshan ma med pa dang / gang smon pa med pas chos rnams smon pa med par mi byed de chos rnams nyid smon pa med par gang dag de ltar so sor rtog pa de ni 'od srungs dbu ma'i lam chos rnams la yang dag par so sor rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos rnams nyid mtshan ma med pa dang / gang smon pa med pas chos rnams smon pa med par mi byed de chos rnams nyid smon pa med par gang dag de ltar so sor rtog pa de ni 'od srungs dbu ma'i lam chos rnams la yang dag par so sor rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Phenomena themselves are signless, and since they are wishless, phenomena are not made wishless. Those who discern in that way that phenomena themselves are wishless, Kāśyapa, that is called the middle way, the correct discernment of phenomena.

original: 'od srungs gang dag stong pa nyid du dmigs pas stong pa nyid la rtog pa de dag ni ngas gsung rab 'di las nyams rab tu nyams zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'od srungs gang dag stong pa nyid du dmigs pas stong pa nyid la rtog pa de dag ni ngas gsung rab 'di las nyams rab tu nyams zhes bshad do //
translated: Kāśyapa, I say that those who imagine emptiness by objectifying emptiness fall short, fall short in this teaching.

original: 'od srungs gang zag tu lta ba ri rab tsam la gnas pa ni bla'i /
analyzed: 'od srungs gang zag tu lta ba ri rab tsam la gnas pa ni bla'i /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is better to have the view of the person, as vast as Mount Meru,

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can stong pa nyid du lta ba ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can stong pa nyid du lta ba ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: than to have the pride of emptiness of one who is not a practitioner.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'od srungs lta bar gyur pa thams cad las byung ba ni stong pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'od srungs lta bar gyur pa thams cad las byung ba ni stong pa nyid yin na /
translated: Kāśyapa, emptiness is the escape from all views.

original: 'od srungs gang stong pa nyid kho nar lta ba de ni gsor mi rung ngo zhes ngas bshad do //
analyzed: 'od srungs gang stong pa nyid kho nar lta ba de ni gsor mi rung ngo zhes ngas bshad do //
translated: Kāśyapa, I say that one who views emptiness alone is incurable.

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na min pa zhig yod la /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na min pa zhig yod la /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this: Suppose there is a man who is sick,

original: sman pas de la sman btang nas sman des de'i nad thams cad bskyod de sman lto na 'dug pa de nyid mi 'byung na /
analyzed: sman pas de la sman btang nas sman des de'i nad thams cad bskyod de sman lto na 'dug pa de nyid mi 'byung na /
translated: and a doctor gives him medicine, and that medicine moves through all his illnesses, but that medicine itself does not come out.

original: 'od srungs 'di'i snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di'i snyam du sems /
translated: Kāśyapa, what do you think?

original: mi de nad de las thar bar 'gyur ram gsol pa /
analyzed: mi de nad de las thar bar 'gyur ram gsol pa /
translated: Will that man be freed from his illness?”

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni mi 'gyur lags te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni mi 'gyur lags te /
translated: He replied, “No, Blessed One.

original: gang sman des nad thams cad bskyod nas sman ltor mchis pa de nyid ma byung na /
analyzed: gang sman des nad thams cad bskyod nas sman ltor mchis pa de nyid ma byung na /
translated: If that medicine moves through all his illnesses but that medicine itself does not come out,

original: mi de'i bro nad shin tu tshabs che par 'gyur lags so //
analyzed: mi de'i bro nad shin tu tshabs che par 'gyur lags so //
translated: that man’s illness will be very serious.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: 'od srungs de bzhin du lta bar gyur pa thams cad las 'byung ba ni stong pa nyid kho nar yin na /
analyzed: 'od srungs de bzhin du lta bar gyur pa thams cad las 'byung ba ni stong pa nyid kho nar yin na /
translated: “Kāśyapa, in the same way, the only way out of all views is emptiness.

original: 'od srungs gang dag stong pa nyid kho nar lta ba de ni gsor mi rung ngo zhes ngas bshad do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //🔽slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas sbyar ba'i tshig gsal ba las /
analyzed: 'od srungs gang dag stong pa nyid kho nar lta ba de ni gsor mi rung ngo zhes ngas bshad do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o // slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas sbyar ba'i tshig gsal ba las /
translated: Kāśyapa, I say that those who view emptiness alone are incurable.

original: 'du byed brtag pa zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa bcu gsum pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: 'du byed brtag pa zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa bcu gsum pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the thirteenth chapter, having  the name “Examination of Composition,” in the root text of the Treatise of the Middle Way, composed by the master Nāgārjuna.

original: // /'dir smras pa /
analyzed: // /'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin ni yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin ni yod pa nyid de /
translated: “The intrinsic reality of things exists,

original: de dag gi phrad pa nye bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi phrad pa nye bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their contact is taught.

original: 'dir gang med pa de la ni phrad pa med do //
analyzed: 'dir gang med pa de la ni phrad pa med do //
translated: Here, that which does not exist has no contact,

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu dang bu mo gnyis @84b bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu dang bu mo gnyis @84b bzhin no //
translated: like, for example, the son of a barren woman and a girl.

original: mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba dang / gsum 'dus pa las reg pa'o //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba dang / gsum 'dus pa las reg pa'o //
translated: It is said, ‘The eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms,’ and ‘From the assembly of three, contact.’

original: reg pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni tshor ba'o zhes rgya cher 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du tshor ba dang 'du shes zhes bya ba'i chos 'di gnyis ni phrad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: reg pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni tshor ba'o zhes rgya cher 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du tshor ba dang 'du shes zhes bya ba'i chos 'di gnyis ni phrad pa yin gyi /
translated: And feeling arises simultaneously with contact.🔽And in the same way, the two things called feeling and perception are in contact, not not in contact.

original: ma phrad pa ni ma yin no zhes 'du byed rnams la ni phrad par bstan pa yang yin no //
analyzed: ma phrad pa ni ma yin no zhes 'du byed rnams la ni phrad par bstan pa yang yin no //
translated: Thus, the sutra teaches that formations are in contact.

original: de'i phyir de ltar phrad pa bstan pa las ni dngos po'i rang bzhin yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar phrad pa bstan pa las ni dngos po'i rang bzhin yod pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since the sutra teaches contact, the intrinsic reality of things exists.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: gal te phrad pa nyid yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te phrad pa nyid yod par 'gyur na /
translated: If contact existed,

original: 'di de ltar 'gyur ba zhig na yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di de ltar 'gyur ba zhig na yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: this would be so, but it does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Why is that?

original: blta bya lta ba lta ba po //
analyzed: blta bya lta ba lta ba po //
translated: The seen, seeing, and the perceiver,

original: gsum po de dag gnyis gnyis dang // thams cad kyang ni phan tshun du //
analyzed: gsum po de dag gnyis gnyis dang // thams cad kyang ni phan tshun du //
translated: these three

original: phrad par 'gyur ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: phrad par 'gyur ba yod ma yin //
translated: do not make mutual contact🔽in any way.

original: de la blta bya ni gzugs so //🔽lta ba ni mig go //
analyzed: de la blta bya ni gzugs so // lta ba ni mig go //
translated: Here the seen is form.🔽Seeing is the eye.

original: lta ba po ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba po ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The perceiver is the eye consciousness.

original: gsum po 'di dag las rnam pa gnyis gnyis phrad pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag las rnam pa gnyis gnyis phrad pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: These three do not make contact in any of the three ways.

original: mig dang gzugs sam /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs sam /
translated: The eye does not make contact with form,

original: mig dang rnam par shes pa'am /
analyzed: mig dang rnam par shes pa'am /
translated: the eye does not make contact with visual consciousness,

original: rnam par shes pa dang gzugs la phrad pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang gzugs la phrad pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: and visual consciousness does not make contact with form.

original: de ltar rnam pa gnyis gnyis dang phrad pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gnyis gnyis dang phrad pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the two do not make contact.

original: thams cad kyang ni ste gsum po de dag cig car phrad pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyang ni ste gsum po de dag cig car phrad pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor do all three make contact simultaneously.

original: ji ltar blta bar bya ba dang lta ba dang lta ba po rnams gnyis gnyis sam thams cad du yang phrad pa med pa /
analyzed: ji ltar blta bar bya ba dang lta ba dang lta ba po rnams gnyis gnyis sam thams cad du yang phrad pa med pa /
translated: Just as the object seen, seeing, and the seer do not make contact in any of the three ways,

original: de bzhin 'dod chags chags pa dang / chags par bya ba lta ba ste /🔽'dod chags dang chags pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin 'dod chags chags pa dang / chags par bya ba lta ba ste / 'dod chags dang chags pa'am /
translated: so too desire, the desirous one, and the object of desire

original: 'dod chags dang chags par bya ba la phrad pa yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang chags par bya ba la phrad pa yod pa ma yin la /
translated: desire does not make contact with the desirous one,🔽desire does not make contact with the object of desire,🔽and the desirous one does not make contact with the object of desire.

original: gsum po dag cig car yang phrad pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gsum po dag cig car yang phrad pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor do all three make contact simultaneously.

original: 'di dag ji ltar yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di dag ji ltar yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as these do not make contact,

original: nyon mongs pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa /
translated: so too the afflictions,🔽the afflicted one, and the objects of affliction

original: lhag ma rnams dang skye mched kyi //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams dang skye mched kyi //
translated: The rest and the remainder of the sense bases

original: lhag ma'ang rnam gsum nyid kyis so //
analyzed: lhag ma'ang rnam gsum nyid kyis so //
translated: are also threefold.

original: ste phan tshun du phrad par 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin no //🔽rnam pa gsum ni rnam gsum mo //
analyzed: ste phan tshun du phrad par 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin no // rnam pa gsum ni rnam gsum mo //
translated: There is no mutual contact.🔽The three aspects are threefold.

original: rnam pa gsum gyi dngos po ni rnam gsum nyid de /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum gyi dngos po ni rnam gsum nyid de /
translated: The state of being threefold is threefoldness.

original: rnam gsum nyid nges so //
analyzed: rnam gsum nyid nges so //
translated: Threefoldness is ascertained.

original: nyon mongs pa lhag ma ni zhe sdang dang gti mug la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa lhag ma ni zhe sdang dang gti mug la sogs pa dag go //
translated: The remaining afflictions are hatred, delusion, and so on.

original: de dag ni zhe sdang dang zhe sdang ba po dang / spang bya la sogs pa rnam pa gsum gyis yin la /🔽nyan pa dang / nyan pa po dang / mnyan par bya ba la sogs pa @85a * //
analyzed: de dag ni zhe sdang dang zhe sdang ba po dang / spang bya la sogs pa rnam pa gsum gyis yin la / nyan pa dang / nyan pa po dang / mnyan par bya ba la sogs pa @85a * //
translated: They are threefold in terms of the object of hatred, the hater, and the object of abandonment, and so on.

original: gsum gyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: gsum gyis kyang ngo //
translated: They are also threefold in terms of the hearer, the hearer, and the object of hearing, and so on.

original: yang ci'i phyir 'di dag la phrad par yod pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'di dag la phrad par yod pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why do they not have mutual contact?

original: gzhan dang gzhan du phrad 'gyur na //
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan du phrad 'gyur na //
translated: If they were to contact each other,

original: gang phyir blta bya la sogs pa //🔽gzhan de yod pa ma yin pa //🔽de phyir phrad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang phyir blta bya la sogs pa // gzhan de yod pa ma yin pa // de phyir phrad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then the object of seeing and so on🔽would exist as another.🔽But because that does not exist,

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: they do not contact each other.

original: gang phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni gang gi phyir gyi don la'o //
analyzed: gang phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni gang gi phyir gyi don la'o //
translated: “Because” has the meaning of “since.”

original: gal te blta bar bya ba la sogs pa dag la phan tshun du gzhan nyid yod na ni /
analyzed: gal te blta bar bya ba la sogs pa dag la phan tshun du gzhan nyid yod na ni /
translated: If the object seen and so on were to exist as different from each other,

original: de'i tshe chu dang 'o ma gnyis bzhin du phan tshun phrad pa yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de'i tshe chu dang 'o ma gnyis bzhin du phan tshun phrad pa yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then they would make mutual contact, just as water and milk do.

original: gang gi phyir blta bar bya ba la sogs pa dag la gzhan de yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir blta bar bya ba la sogs pa dag la gzhan de yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: But because the object seen and so on do not exist as different from each other,

original: de dag phrad par mi 'gyur ro //🔽gzhan yang / blta bya la sogs 'ba' zhig la //
analyzed: de dag phrad par mi 'gyur ro // gzhan yang / blta bya la sogs 'ba' zhig la //
translated: they do not make mutual contact.🔽Moreover,🔽Not only is difference

original: gzhan nyid med par ma zad kyi /🔽gang yang gang dang lhan cig tu //
analyzed: gzhan nyid med par ma zad kyi / gang yang gang dang lhan cig tu //
translated: Not possible for the object seen and so on,🔽But also,

original: gzhan pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gzhan pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable that anything is different from itself.

original: blta bar bya ba la sogs pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por gnas pa rnams 'ba' zhig la gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: blta bar bya ba la sogs pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por gnas pa rnams 'ba' zhig la gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin par ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is difference not possible for the object seen and so on that exist as cause and effect,

original: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad la yang yod pa ma yin no zhes nges par bya'o //
analyzed: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad la yang yod pa ma yin no zhes nges par bya'o //
translated: It should be ascertained that this is not the case for all things, such as vases and cloth.

original: blta bar bya ba la sogs pa 'di dag la phan tshun gzhan nyid ji ltar med pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: blta bar bya ba la sogs pa 'di dag la phan tshun gzhan nyid ji ltar med pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate how mutual difference does not exist in these objects of seeing and so on, it is said:

original: gzhan ni gzhan la brten te gzhan //
analyzed: gzhan ni gzhan la brten te gzhan //
translated: The other is other in dependence on the other.

original: gzhan med par gzhan gzhan mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan med par gzhan gzhan mi 'gyur //
translated: Without the other, the other would not be other.

original: gang la brten te gang yin pa //
analyzed: gang la brten te gang yin pa //
translated: That which is dependent on this

original: de ni de las gzhan mi 'thad //🔽ces gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni de las gzhan mi 'thad // ces gsungs te /
translated: is not tenable as other than this.

original: 'dir bum pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po snam bu las gzhan no zhes brjod pa gang yin pa'i gzhan de ni gzhan la brten nas gzhan du 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dir bum pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po snam bu las gzhan no zhes brjod pa gang yin pa'i gzhan de ni gzhan la brten nas gzhan du 'gyur la /
translated: Here, that which is called “vase” is said to be “other than cloth.” The other is other in dependence on the other.

original: dngos po gzhan med par te gzhan mi bdog par ni gzhan gzhan du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan med par te gzhan mi bdog par ni gzhan gzhan du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Without the other, that is, without the other existing, the other would not be other.

original: bum pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po gang zhig snam bu zhes bya ba'i dngos po gzhan la brten nas gzhan yin par 'gyur ba'i bum pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po de ni snam bu'i dngos po de las gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhes bya bar
analyzed: bum pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po gang zhig snam bu zhes bya ba'i dngos po gzhan la brten nas gzhan yin par 'gyur ba'i bum pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po de ni snam bu'i dngos po de las gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhes bya bar
translated: The thing called “pot” that is different in dependence on the thing called “cloth” is not different from the thing called “cloth.”

original: nges par bya'o //
analyzed: nges par bya'o //
translated: This should be ascertained.

original: gang gi phyir gang la brten nas gang zhig tu 'gyur ba de ni de las gzhan du mi 'gyur te /🔽ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir sa bon dang myu gu 'am /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang la brten nas gang zhig tu 'gyur ba de ni de las gzhan du mi 'gyur te / ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir sa bon dang myu gu 'am /
translated: Because that which becomes something in dependence on something else is not different from it,🔽like a seed and a sprout, or like long and short,

original: ring po dang thung ngu bzhin no //
analyzed: ring po dang thung ngu bzhin no //
translated: because they are related.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang la brten te gang 'byung ba //
analyzed: gang la brten te gang 'byung ba //
translated: That which arises in dependence on this

original: de ni re zhig de nyid min //
analyzed: de ni re zhig de nyid min //
translated: is not the same as this.

original: de ni gzhan pa'ang ma yin phyir //
analyzed: de ni gzhan pa'ang ma yin phyir //
translated: Because it is not different from this,

original: @85b de phyir rtag min chad ma yin //🔽zhes 'tshang par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @85b de phyir rtag min chad ma yin // zhes 'tshang par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore it is not annihilated nor eternal.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone says:

original: gal te snam bu ni bum pa las gzhan yin la /
analyzed: gal te snam bu ni bum pa las gzhan yin la /
translated: If cloth is different from a pot,

original: tha dad par gyur pa'i snam bu de la ltos nas bum pa gzhan du 'gyur na de'i tshe nyes pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: tha dad par gyur pa'i snam bu de la ltos nas bum pa gzhan du 'gyur na de'i tshe nyes pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: But if the vase is different from the cloth, then what fault ensues?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: gal te gzhan ni gzhan las gzhan /
analyzed: gal te gzhan ni gzhan las gzhan /
translated: If the other is different from the other,

original: de tshe gzhan med par gzhan 'gyur //
analyzed: de tshe gzhan med par gzhan 'gyur //
translated: then it would be different without another.

original: gzhan med par ni gzhan 'gyur ba //🔽yod min de yi phyir na med //
analyzed: gzhan med par ni gzhan 'gyur ba // yod min de yi phyir na med //
translated: But without another, the other

original: ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ste /
translated: does not exist, and therefore it does not exist.

original: 'dir gzhan gyi sgra gcig ni nye bar bstan par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan gyi sgra gcig ni nye bar bstan par bya ba yin la /
translated: Here, one instance of the term “other” is that which is to be demonstrated.

original: gzhan ni don gzhan 'dzin pa yin zhing /
analyzed: gzhan ni don gzhan 'dzin pa yin zhing /
translated: Another instance of the term “other” is that which apprehends another object.

original: yang gzhan ni rab tu grags par gyur pa brjod pa yin pas gzhan gyi sgra gsum nye bar bkod do //🔽gal te bum pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po de gzhan snam bu las gzhan yin par 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: yang gzhan ni rab tu grags par gyur pa brjod pa yin pas gzhan gyi sgra gsum nye bar bkod do // gal te bum pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po de gzhan snam bu las gzhan yin par 'gyur na ni /
translated: And another instance of the term “other” is that which is expressed in common usage. Thus, three instances of the term “other” are presented here.🔽If the thing called “vase” were different from the other, the cloth,

original: bum pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po de gzhan snam bu med par yang gzhan du 'gyur te /
analyzed: bum pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po de gzhan snam bu med par yang gzhan du 'gyur te /
translated: then the thing called “vase” would be different without the other, the cloth.

original: de'i tshe snam bu la ma ltos pa'i bum pa gcig pu gzhan nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe snam bu la ma ltos pa'i bum pa gcig pu gzhan nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, a vase that does not rely on a cloth would be a different object.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig gang las gzhan yin pa de ni de med par yang 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig gang las gzhan yin pa de ni de med par yang 'grub ste /
translated: In that case, that which is different from something is established without that.

original: dper na bum pa de nyid rang gi ngo bor grub pa las gzhan snam bu la mi ltos pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa de nyid rang gi ngo bor grub pa las gzhan snam bu la mi ltos pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, just like a vase that is established from its own entity is different from a cloth that does not rely on it.

original: de bzhin du gal te bum pa'i gzhan nyid gzhan snam bu las yin na ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te bum pa'i gzhan nyid gzhan snam bu las yin na ni /
translated: In the same way, if the difference of a vase is from another, a cloth,

original: de'i tshe snam bu la ma ltos pa'i bum pa la yang gzhan nyid yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe snam bu la ma ltos pa'i bum pa la yang gzhan nyid yin par 'gyur na /
translated: at that time, a vase that does not rely on a cloth would also be different.

original: snam bu la ma ltos pa'i bum pa gcig pu la ni gzhan nyid ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: snam bu la ma ltos pa'i bum pa gcig pu la ni gzhan nyid ma mthong ngo //
translated: But a vase that does not rely on a cloth is not seen to be different.

original: de'i phyir // gzhan la brten nas gzhan du 'gyur ro zhes smra ba na /
analyzed: de'i phyir // gzhan la brten nas gzhan du 'gyur ro zhes smra ba na /
translated: Therefore, when you say, “A different object becomes different in dependence on another,”

original: gang la ltos nas gang zhig gzhan yin pa de ni de las gzhan ma yin no zhes gsal bar khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang la ltos nas gang zhig gzhan yin pa de ni de las gzhan ma yin no zhes gsal bar khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: it is clearly asserted that that which is different in dependence on something is not different from that.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say this:

original: gal te de ltar 'ga' zhig las gzhan nyid 'ga' zhig la yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar 'ga' zhig las gzhan nyid 'ga' zhig la yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If difference does not exist in any way in any other,

original: de'i tshe gang gi phyir gzhan ni gzhan la brten nas gzhan yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe gang gi phyir gzhan ni gzhan la brten nas gzhan yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: then at that time, since the other is the other in dependence on the other,

original: de gzhan du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyang brjod par mi srid pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de gzhan du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyang brjod par mi srid pa ma yin nam /
translated: how could it be that it is impossible to say that “it does not become other”?

original: brjod par bya ste /🔽gang gi phyir /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste / gang gi phyir /
translated: We reply:

original: dngos po rnams kyi gzhan nyid grub pa phan tshun ltos pa ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi gzhan nyid grub pa phan tshun ltos pa ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because the difference of things is not established through mutual dependence,

original: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad la gnas te gzhan zhes brjod kyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad la gnas te gzhan zhes brjod kyi /
translated: we say that we speak of “other” in terms of worldly convention,

original: dngos su na gzhan nyid brtags pa na yod pa ma yin no zhes smra'o //🔽gal te gzhan nyid @86a * //
analyzed: dngos su na gzhan nyid brtags pa na yod pa ma yin no zhes smra'o // gal te gzhan nyid @86a * //
translated: but in reality, when difference is investigated, it does not exist.

original: yod pa ma yin yang /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin yang /
translated: If difference does not exist,

original: 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob tu bum pa snam bu las gzhan yin no zhes brjod na /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob tu bum pa snam bu las gzhan yin no zhes brjod na /
translated: why do you say that in worldly convention a vase is different from a cloth?

original: 'o na ni sa bon dang myu gu gnyis kyang gzhan nyid du ci'i phyir mi smra zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni sa bon dang myu gu gnyis kyang gzhan nyid du ci'i phyir mi smra zhe na /
translated: Well then, why do you not say that the seed and sprout are also different?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: 'jig rten pas ni sa bon dang myu gu gnyis bum pa dang / snam bu ltar gzhan nyid du mi rtogs pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'jig rten pas ni sa bon dang myu gu gnyis bum pa dang / snam bu ltar gzhan nyid du mi rtogs pa nyid de /
translated: Worldly people do not conceive the seed and sprout to be different, like a pot and cloth,

original: bum pa dang snam bu ltar bskyed bya skyed byed nyid med par thal ba'i phyir dang / cig car yod par thal bar 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa dang snam bu ltar bskyed bya skyed byed nyid med par thal ba'i phyir dang / cig car yod par thal bar 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it follows they would not be producer and produced, like a pot and cloth, and because it follows they would exist simultaneously.

original: gzhan yang gang gi phyir 'jig rten pa ni shing 'di ngas btsugs so zhes sa bon tsam zhig btsugs nas sa bon gyi 'bras bu shing ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang gi phyir 'jig rten pa ni shing 'di ngas btsugs so zhes sa bon tsam zhig btsugs nas sa bon gyi 'bras bu shing ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, because worldly people, having planted just a seed, say, “I planted this tree,” and point out the tree as the result of the seed,

original: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa rnams kyi gzhan nyid ni 'jig rten na yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar rnam par 'jog pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa rnams kyi gzhan nyid ni 'jig rten na yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar rnam par 'jog pa yin no //
translated: therefore, even in the world, otherness does not exist between things that are cause and effect.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: gal te dngos po gzhan la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i gzhan gyi blo 'byung na ni /
analyzed: gal te dngos po gzhan la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i gzhan gyi blo 'byung na ni /
translated: “If the cognition of otherness arises in dependence on other things,

original: de'i phyir de gzhan du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nyes pa 'dir 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de gzhan du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nyes pa 'dir 'gyur na /
translated: then this error would arise: ‘Therefore, it would not be other.’”

original: de skad du ni mi smra ste /
analyzed: de skad du ni mi smra ste /
translated: But we do not say that.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What do we say?

original: 'di na gzhan nyid ces bya ba spyi yang yin la khyad par yang yin pa zhig yod pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di na gzhan nyid ces bya ba spyi yang yin la khyad par yang yin pa zhig yod pa yin la /
translated: Here, otherness is a universal and also a particular.

original: de gang la 'du ba'i dngos po de ni dngos po gzhan la ltos pa med kyang gzhan zhes rjod par byed de /
analyzed: de gang la 'du ba'i dngos po de ni dngos po gzhan la ltos pa med kyang gzhan zhes rjod par byed de /
translated: That which is the entity in which it inheres is called “other” even without depending on another entity.

original: de'i phyir kho bo cag gi phyogs la smras pa'i nyes pa'i go skabs med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo cag gi phyogs la smras pa'i nyes pa'i go skabs med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no opportunity for the fault that we have stated to apply to our position.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: gal te gzhan nyid yod na ni 'di de ltar 'gyur na yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te gzhan nyid yod na ni 'di de ltar 'gyur na yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If otherness existed, it would be like that, but it does not exist.

original: 'dir gzhan nyid 'di rtog pa na //
analyzed: 'dir gzhan nyid 'di rtog pa na //
translated: Here, when you conceive of otherness,

original: gzhan nam gzhan ma yin pa zhig la rtog grangs gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir //🔽gzhan nyid gzhan /
analyzed: gzhan nam gzhan ma yin pa zhig la rtog grangs gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir // gzhan nyid gzhan /
translated: whether you conceive of it in terms of other or non-other, neither is tenable.🔽To demonstrate this, it is said:

original: la yod ma yin //
analyzed: la yod ma yin //
translated: Otherness does not exist in other.

original: gzhan ma yin la'ang yod ma yin //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin la'ang yod ma yin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Otherness also does not exist in non-other.

original: de la gal te gzhan la gzhan nyid yod do zhes rtog na ni /
analyzed: de la gal te gzhan la gzhan nyid yod do zhes rtog na ni /
translated: If you conceive that otherness exists in other,

original: gzhan nyid brtags pas ci zhig bya //
analyzed: gzhan nyid brtags pas ci zhig bya //
translated: What is the use of investigating otherness?

original: gzhan nyid du rtogs pa ni gzhan du brjod pa grub par bya ba'i phyir yin na /
analyzed: gzhan nyid du rtogs pa ni gzhan du brjod pa grub par bya ba'i phyir yin na /
translated: The understanding of otherness is for the purpose of establishing the expression “other.”

original: gzhan du brjod pa de ni gzhan nyid med par yang grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan du brjod pa de ni gzhan nyid med par yang grub pa nyid de /
translated: But that expression “other” is established even without otherness,

original: gang gi phyir gzhan du brjod pa rnyed pa'i dngos po gzhan la gzhan nyid rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan du brjod pa rnyed pa'i dngos po gzhan la gzhan nyid rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the expression “other” is applied to a different thing that is found.

original: de ltar na re zhig gzhan la gzhan nyid mi srid do //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig gzhan la gzhan nyid mi srid do //
translated: Thus, otherness is impossible in another.

original: da ni gzhan ma yin pa la yang gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: da ni gzhan ma yin pa la yang gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Now, otherness does not exist in that which is not other.

original: gang gi phyir gzhan ma yin pa ni gcig nyid la bya la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan ma yin pa ni gcig nyid la bya la /
translated: Because that which is not other is called “one,”

original: @86b de la ni gzhan nyid dang 'gal ba gcig nyid yod pa de'i phyir 'gal bas /🔽gzhan ma yin pa la yang gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: @86b de la ni gzhan nyid dang 'gal ba gcig nyid yod pa de'i phyir 'gal bas / gzhan ma yin pa la yang gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: and since one is incompatible with otherness,🔽otherness does not exist in that which is not other.

original: gang zhig de ltar gzhan dang gzhan nyid ma yin pa la yod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gang zhig de ltar gzhan dang gzhan nyid ma yin pa la yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: That which does not exist in another and that which is not other

original: de dag las ma gtogs pa'i dngos po med pas de dag las ma gtogs pa'i dngos po la yang yod pa ma yin pa de ni med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag las ma gtogs pa'i dngos po med pas de dag las ma gtogs pa'i dngos po la yang yod pa ma yin pa de ni med pa nyid do //
translated: Since there is no entity that is not included among those, it also does not exist in an entity that is not included among those. That is nonexistence.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar gzhan nyid med pa de'i tshe gzhan nyid dang 'du ba'i rgyu can blo dang sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu dngos po gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar gzhan nyid med pa de'i tshe gzhan nyid dang 'du ba'i rgyu can blo dang sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu dngos po gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: Since otherness does not exist in that way, it is established that the cause of the engagement of cognition and speech, which is the cause of the connection of otherness, does not exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone says:

original: gal te gzhan nyid med pa de lta na yang gzhan ni re zhig yod pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te gzhan nyid med pa de lta na yang gzhan ni re zhig yod pa yin la /
translated: If otherness does not exist, then otherness exists in some way.

original: gzhan nyid med par ni gzhan yod par 'os pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan nyid med par ni gzhan yod par 'os pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not tenable that otherness exists without otherness.

original: de'i phyir gzhan nyid kyang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan nyid kyang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore otherness also exists.

original: brjod par bya ste /🔽gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: brjod par bya ste / gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin na //
translated: We reply:🔽If otherness does not exist,

original: gzhan nam de nyid yod ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan nam de nyid yod ma yin //
translated: Neither other nor that itself exist.

original: gang gi tshe sngar gzhan nyid ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan zin pa de'i tshe gzhan nyid med par gzhan nam de nyid yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sngar gzhan nyid ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan zin pa de'i tshe gzhan nyid med par gzhan nam de nyid yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: But when it has already been demonstrated that difference does not exist previously, then how could difference or identity exist without difference?

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni gzhan ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni gzhan ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Identity” means “non-difference.”

original: de'i phyir gzhan nam de nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan nam de nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, neither difference nor identity exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say this:

original: lta ba la sogs pa dag ni yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa dag ni yod pa nyid de /
translated: Seeing and so on do exist,

original: phrad pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phrad pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because contact exists.

original: 'dir gal te yang lta ba la sogs pa dag la gzhan nyid med do zhes bstan zin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'dir gal te yang lta ba la sogs pa dag la gzhan nyid med do zhes bstan zin mod kyi /
translated: Here, although it has been demonstrated that seeing and so on do not have difference,

original: de lta na yang reg pa ni gsum 'dus shing tshogs pa'o zhes bya bas phrad pa yang yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang reg pa ni gsum 'dus shing tshogs pa'o zhes bya bas phrad pa yang yod pa yin te /
translated: nevertheless, contact exists because it is said that contact is the convergence and assembly of three.

original: de'i phyir phrad pa yod pas lta ba la sogs pa dag yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir phrad pa yod pas lta ba la sogs pa dag yod pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, because contact exists, seeing and so on exist.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: gal te de dag phrad pa nyid yod na ni de ltar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te de dag phrad pa nyid yod na ni de ltar 'gyur na /
translated: If the existence of contact were tenable, then this would be so.

original: yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it does not exist.

original: ji ltar yod pa ma yin pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa ma yin pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate how they do not exist, it says:

original: de ni de dang phrad pa med //
analyzed: de ni de dang phrad pa med //
translated: They do not contact themselves.

original: gzhan dang gzhan yang phrad mi 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan yang phrad mi 'gyur // zhes gsungs te /
translated: Nor do they contact the other.

original: 'dir gal te lta ba la sogs pa dang phrad pa yin na /
analyzed: 'dir gal te lta ba la sogs pa dang phrad pa yin na /
translated: Here, if seeing and so on contact each other,

original: de dag gcig nyid dam gzhan nyid du brtag grang /
analyzed: de dag gcig nyid dam gzhan nyid du brtag grang /
translated: would they be examined as the same or different?

original: de la gcig nyid yin na ni phrad pa med de /
analyzed: de la gcig nyid yin na ni phrad pa med de /
translated: If they are the same, there is no contact.

original: chu la ltos pa med pa'i 'o ma gcig pu la ni chu dang phrad pa zhes mi brjod do //
analyzed: chu la ltos pa med pa'i 'o ma gcig pu la ni chu dang phrad pa zhes mi brjod do //
translated: Milk alone, without any dependence on water, is not called “contacting water.”

original: tha dad pa yin na yang phrad pa med de /
analyzed: tha dad pa yin na yang phrad pa med de /
translated: If they are different, there is no contact.

original: chu las tha dad du gnas pa'i 'o ma la ni chu dang phrad pa zhes mi smra'o //
analyzed: chu las tha dad du gnas pa'i 'o ma la ni chu dang phrad pa zhes mi smra'o //
translated: Milk that exists as different from water is not said to “contact water.”

original: de ltar gal te lta ba la sogs pa dag gcig nyid @87a * //🔽yin pa na /
analyzed: de ltar gal te lta ba la sogs pa dag gcig nyid @87a * // yin pa na /
translated: Thus, if seeing and so on are the same,

original: phrad par rtog na de ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: phrad par rtog na de ni mi 'thad de /
translated: if you imagine they contact each other, that is untenable.

original: mig gcig pu la yang phrad pa yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig gcig pu la yang phrad pa yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows that a single eye would have contact.

original: 'on te tha dad pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'on te tha dad pa nyid yin na /
translated: But if they are different,

original: de lta na yang mi 'thad pa nyid de /
analyzed: de lta na yang mi 'thad pa nyid de /
translated: But that is not tenable.

original: gzugs la sogs pa las so sor gyur pa'i mig gcig pu la yang phrad pa yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa las so sor gyur pa'i mig gcig pu la yang phrad pa yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows that a single eye, which is different from form and so on, would also make contact.

original: phrad pa med na ni lta ba la sogs pa yang med do zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: phrad pa med na ni lta ba la sogs pa yang med do zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: If there is no contact, then seeing and so on would not exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say:

original: gal te yang phrad pa yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te yang phrad pa yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Even though contact does not exist,

original: de lta na yang phrad bzhin pa dang phrad pa dang / phrad pa po ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang phrad bzhin pa dang phrad pa dang / phrad pa po ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: that which is in the process of making contact, that which has made contact, and the one who makes contact exist,

original: de dag bkag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag bkag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their negation is not established.

original: phrad bzhin pa dang phrad pa dang phrad pa po ni phrad pa med par yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: phrad bzhin pa dang phrad pa dang phrad pa po ni phrad pa med par yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: That which is in the process of making contact, that which has made contact, and the one who makes contact do not exist without contact.

original: de'i phyir phrad pa yang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir phrad pa yang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, contact also exists.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: 'di yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di yang mi rigs te /
translated: This is also illogical.

original: gang gi phyir gang gi tshe phrad pa nyid med do zhes bstan pa de'i tshe phrad pa med par phrad bzhin pa la sogs pa yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang gi tshe phrad pa nyid med do zhes bstan pa de'i tshe phrad pa med par phrad bzhin pa la sogs pa yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: Because when it is shown that contact itself does not exist, then how could that which is in the process of contacting, etc., exist without contact?

original: de la phrad bzhin pa ni da ltar ba phrad pa'i bya ba'i sgrub byed las su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la phrad bzhin pa ni da ltar ba phrad pa'i bya ba'i sgrub byed las su gyur pa'o //
translated: Here, that which is in the process of contacting is the present, the object of the action of contact.

original: phrad pa ni phrad pa'i bya ba rdzogs pa can no //
analyzed: phrad pa ni phrad pa'i bya ba rdzogs pa can no //
translated: Contact is the completed action of contact.

original: phrad pa po ni byed pa po bya ba rdzogs par bya ba la rang dbang du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: phrad pa po ni byed pa po bya ba rdzogs par bya ba la rang dbang du gnas pa'o //
translated: The contactor is the agent who is independent in the completion of the action.

original: de'i phyir 'dir phrad pa med pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir phrad pa med pas /
translated: Therefore, since contact does not exist here,

original: phrad bzhin pa la sogs pa ma gzigs shing /
analyzed: phrad bzhin pa la sogs pa ma gzigs shing /
translated: that which is in the process of contacting, etc., are not seen.

original: de dgag pa mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /🔽phrad bzhin pa dang phrad pa dang // phrad pa po yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: de dgag pa mjug bsdu ba'i phyir / phrad bzhin pa dang phrad pa dang // phrad pa po yang yod ma yin //
translated: In order to conclude the refutation of that, it is said:

original: zhes gsungs so //🔽de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: zhes gsungs so // de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: That which is in the process of contacting, contact, and the contactor do not exist.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /🔽mig ni ldan na thams cad mthong 'gyur te //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang / mig ni ldan na thams cad mthong 'gyur te //
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavān also said:🔽When the eye is present, all is seen.

original: mig gis gzugs rnams mthong ba gang yin pa'ang //
analyzed: mig gis gzugs rnams mthong ba gang yin pa'ang //
translated: Whatever forms are seen by the eye,

original: mtshan mo rkyen rnams med na mthong mi 'gyur //
analyzed: mtshan mo rkyen rnams med na mthong mi 'gyur //
translated: At night, without conditions, they are not seen.

original: de phyir ldan dang bral ba rnam rtog yin //
analyzed: de phyir ldan dang bral ba rnam rtog yin //
translated: Therefore, connection and separation are conceptual.🔽The eye, in dependence on light, sees various forms,

original: mig ni snang la brten te yid 'ong dang // yid du mi 'ong sna tshogs gzugs mthong bas //
analyzed: mig ni snang la brten te yid 'ong dang // yid du mi 'ong sna tshogs gzugs mthong bas //
translated: Attractive and unattractive.

original: de ltar ldan pa brten te mthong bas na //
analyzed: de ltar ldan pa brten te mthong bas na //
translated: Thus, in dependence on connection, it sees.

original: de phyir mig gis nam yang mthong ba med //
analyzed: de phyir mig gis nam yang mthong ba med //
translated: Therefore, the eye never sees.

original: gang dag rang bzhin med chos 'di shes pa ;
analyzed: gang dag rang bzhin med chos 'di shes pa ;
translated: Those heroes who know this dharma of no intrinsic nature

original: ; dpa' bo de dag 'jig rten mya ngan 'da' //
analyzed: ; dpa' bo de dag 'jig rten mya ngan 'da' //
translated: Are liberated from the world.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan spyod cing chags med cing //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan spyod cing chags med cing //
translated: Engaging in the qualities of desire without attachment,

original: chags pa rnams spangs sems can 'dul bar byed //
analyzed: chags pa rnams spangs sems can 'dul bar byed //
translated: They tame beings, abandoning attachment.

original: 'di na sems can 'ga' med srog med kyang //
analyzed: 'di na sems can 'ga' med srog med kyang //
translated: Here, although there are no sentient beings or life force,

original: mi dbang rnams ni sems can phan pa mdzad //
analyzed: mi dbang rnams ni sems can phan pa mdzad //
translated: The lords of humans benefit sentient beings.

original: sems can yod pa min yang @87b don mdzad pa //
analyzed: sems can yod pa min yang @87b don mdzad pa //
translated: Although sentient beings do not exist, they perform benefits,

original: de dag rnams kyi don ni dka' ba che //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyi don ni dka' ba che //
translated: And their benefits for them are of great difficulty.

original: zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas /
translated: And so on, up to:

original: de la nam yang chags pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: de la nam yang chags pa yod ma yin //
translated: They are never attached.

original: gang dag chos nyid 'di la mos gyur pa //
analyzed: gang dag chos nyid 'di la mos gyur pa //
translated: Those who aspire to this reality

original: de dag yid ni srid la chags mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag yid ni srid la chags mi 'gyur //
translated: Their minds will not be attached to existence.

original: zhes bya ba'i bar dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly,🔽Whoever meditates on the path, having generated the wisdom

original: gang gis lam bsgoms chos kun stong pa dang // bdag med ye shes rab tu bskyed byas nas //
analyzed: gang gis lam bsgoms chos kun stong pa dang // bdag med ye shes rab tu bskyed byas nas //
translated: Of the emptiness and selflessness of all phenomena,

original: chos 'di dag ni rnam par bsgom 'gyur ba //
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni rnam par bsgom 'gyur ba //
translated: Will meditate on these phenomena.

original: de yi spobs pa thogs pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi spobs pa thogs pa med par 'gyur //
translated: Their eloquence will be unimpeded.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas sbyar ba'i tshig gsal ba las /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas sbyar ba'i tshig gsal ba las /
translated: And so on.🔽This is the commentary on the fourteenth chapter, having fourteen verses, called

original: phrad pa brtag pa zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa bcu bzhi pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: phrad pa brtag pa zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa bcu bzhi pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: “the examination of contact.”

original: // /'dir smras pa /
analyzed: // /'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni yod pa nyid de /
translated: The essence of things does exist,

original: de dag skyed par byed pa'i rgyu dang rkyen nye bar len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag skyed par byed pa'i rgyu dang rkyen nye bar len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because causes and conditions that give rise to them are appropriated.

original: 'dir gang yang yod pa ma yin pa de la ni skyed par byed pa'i rgyu dang rkyen nye bar len pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gang yang yod pa ma yin pa de la ni skyed par byed pa'i rgyu dang rkyen nye bar len pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, that which does not exist at all does not have causes and conditions that give rise to it, because it is nonexistent.

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like a sky flower.

original: myu gu dang 'du byed la sogs pa rnams skyed par byed pa'i rgyu dang rkyen sa bon dang ma rig pa la sogs pa dag nye bar len pa yang yin te /
analyzed: myu gu dang 'du byed la sogs pa rnams skyed par byed pa'i rgyu dang rkyen sa bon dang ma rig pa la sogs pa dag nye bar len pa yang yin te /
translated: Moreover, causes and conditions that generate things such as sprouts and compositional activity are also appropriated, such as seeds and ignorance.

original: de'i phyir dngos po'i rang bzhin yod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po'i rang bzhin yod pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, the intrinsic reality of things does exist.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We respond:

original: gal te dngos po 'du byed dang myu gu la sogs pa rnams la rang bzhin yod na ni /
analyzed: gal te dngos po 'du byed dang myu gu la sogs pa rnams la rang bzhin yod na ni /
translated: If things such as compositional activity and sprouts have intrinsic reality,

original: de'i tshe yod par gyur pa rnams la rgyu dang rkyen dag gis dgos pa ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: de'i tshe yod par gyur pa rnams la rgyu dang rkyen dag gis dgos pa ci zhig yod de /
translated: then what purpose do causes and conditions serve for those that exist?

original: ji ltar 'du byed dang myu gu la sogs pa da lta bar gyur pa rnams la yang bskyed par bya ba'i ched du ma rig pa dang / sa bon la sogs pa dag nye bar len par mi byed pa de bzhin du gzhan la yang de bskyed par bya ba'i phyir blang bar mi bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'du byed dang myu gu la sogs pa da lta bar gyur pa rnams la yang bskyed par bya ba'i ched du ma rig pa dang / sa bon la sogs pa dag nye bar len par mi byed pa de bzhin du gzhan la yang de bskyed par bya ba'i phyir blang bar mi bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: Just as seeds and ignorance are not appropriated for the sake of generating compositional activity and sprouts that have already come into existence, so too they would not be appropriated for the sake of generating other things.

original: de'i rang bzhin yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /🔽rang bzhin rgyu dang rkyen las ni //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir / rang bzhin rgyu dang rkyen las ni //
translated: To demonstrate this, he said:🔽It is not logical for an essence

original: 'byung bar rigs pa ma yin no //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'byung bar rigs pa ma yin no // zhes gsungs so //
translated: To arise from causes and conditions.🔽If you think that prior to arising, no entity whatsoever has an essence,

original: ci ste gang las de yod pa nyid kyis skye ba don med par 'gyur ba skye ba'i snga rol du ni dngos po 'ga' la yang rang bzhin yod pa ma yin te /🔽'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste gang las de yod pa nyid kyis skye ba don med par 'gyur ba skye ba'i snga rol du ni dngos po 'ga' la yang rang bzhin yod pa ma yin te / 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: because it would be pointless for it to arise again,

original: skye ba'i snga rol du yod pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin kho na rgyu dang rkyen la brten te phyis 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: skye ba'i snga rol du yod pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin kho na rgyu dang rkyen la brten te phyis 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: but that later, in dependence on causes and conditions, an essence that did not exist previously arises,

original: de ltar 'dod na yang /🔽rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba yi //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod na yang / rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba yi //
translated: then even if you assert this,

original: rang @88a * //
analyzed: rang @88a * //
translated: An essence that arises from causes and conditions

original: bzhin byas pa can du 'gyur ro //🔽ci ste rgyu dang rkyen las byung bas rang bzhin byas pa nyid du 'gyur ba na 'dod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: bzhin byas pa can du 'gyur ro // ci ste rgyu dang rkyen las byung bas rang bzhin byas pa nyid du 'gyur ba na 'dod pa kho na ste /
translated: Would be created.🔽If you think that if it arises from causes and conditions, then an essence would be created, we agree,

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin byas pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin byas pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: because we accept that an essence would be created.

original: byas pa thal bar brtsad pa ni kho bo cag la gnod par byed pa ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: byas pa thal bar brtsad pa ni kho bo cag la gnod par byed pa ma yin no snyam na /
translated: But if you think that the refutation of the consequence does not harm us,

original: 'di yang mi rigs so zhes gsungs pa /🔽rang bzhin byas pa can zhes byar //
analyzed: 'di yang mi rigs so zhes gsungs pa / rang bzhin byas pa can zhes byar //
translated: then this is also unreasonable.🔽How could it be tenable

original: ji lta bur na rung bar 'gyur //🔽byas pa yang yin la /
analyzed: ji lta bur na rung bar 'gyur // byas pa yang yin la /
translated: to call that which is produced a “nature”?

original: rang bzhin yang yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir 'brel pa med pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin yang yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir 'brel pa med pa'i don yin no //
translated: It is unreasonable to say that something is both produced and a nature, because these are mutually exclusive and thus have no relationship.

original: 'di ltar 'dir rang gi ngo bo ni rang bzhin no zhes bya bar bye brag tu bshad pa las na dngos po byas pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten na rang bzhin zhes mi brjod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dir rang gi ngo bo ni rang bzhin no zhes bya bar bye brag tu bshad pa las na dngos po byas pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten na rang bzhin zhes mi brjod de /
