translated: Since the commentary specifies that “nature” means “intrinsic nature,” then whatever thing is produced is not called a “nature” in the world.

original: dper na chu'i tsha ba dang / ke ke ru la sogs pa dag nor sgyur mkhan gyis 'bad pas padma r'a ga la sogs pa'i dngos por byas pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na chu'i tsha ba dang / ke ke ru la sogs pa dag nor sgyur mkhan gyis 'bad pas padma r'a ga la sogs pa'i dngos por byas pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the heat of water and the transformation of gold and so on by an alchemist are produced.

original: gang zhig rang bzhin yin pa de ni ma byas pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig rang bzhin yin pa de ni ma byas pa yin te /
translated: Whatever is a nature is not produced.

original: dper na me'i tsha ba nyid dam /
analyzed: dper na me'i tsha ba nyid dam /
translated: For example, the heat of fire and the nature of a noble being are not produced.

original: padma r'a ga la sogs pa rig ma rnams kyi padma r'a ga la sogs pa rnams kyi ngo bo bzhin te /
analyzed: padma r'a ga la sogs pa rig ma rnams kyi padma r'a ga la sogs pa rnams kyi ngo bo bzhin te /
translated: It is like the nature of the jewels such as rubies, etc., of the consorts of the Buddhas.

original: de ni dngos po gzhan dang phrad pas ma bskyed pa'i phyir de dag gi rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni dngos po gzhan dang phrad pas ma bskyed pa'i phyir de dag gi rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is not generated by contact with other things, it is called their nature.🔽Thus, the nature of things is unfabricated, and worldly conventions remain as they are.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rang bzhin ni ma byas pa yin no zhes 'jig rten gyi tha snyad rnam par gnas pa yin dang / da ni kho bo cag tsha ba nyid gang yin pa de yang byas pa'i phyir mi'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes gzung bar bya'o zhes smra'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rang bzhin ni ma byas pa yin no zhes 'jig rten gyi tha snyad rnam par gnas pa yin dang / da ni kho bo cag tsha ba nyid gang yin pa de yang byas pa'i phyir mi'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes gzung bar bya'o zhes smra'o //
translated: Now, we should understand that heat is not the nature of fire because it is fabricated.

original: 'dir nor bu dang me spru dang nyi ma phrad pa dang / gtsub shing dang gtsubs pa las byung ba'i me ni rgyu dang rkyen la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du dmigs la /
analyzed: 'dir nor bu dang me spru dang nyi ma phrad pa dang / gtsub shing dang gtsubs pa las byung ba'i me ni rgyu dang rkyen la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du dmigs la /
translated: Here, a jewel, a fire, and the sun are observed to be dependent on causes and conditions, and heat is not different from fire.

original: me las gzhan pa'i tsha ba nyid kyang med pa de'i phyir tsha ba nyid kyang rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa yin te /
analyzed: me las gzhan pa'i tsha ba nyid kyang med pa de'i phyir tsha ba nyid kyang rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, heat is also generated by causes and conditions.

original: de'i phyir byas pa yin zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyir byas pa yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, it is a product.

original: byas pa yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: byas pa yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: And because it is a product,

original: chu'i tsha ba bzhin du rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya bar ches gsal bar nges pa yin no //
analyzed: chu'i tsha ba bzhin du rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya bar ches gsal bar nges pa yin no //
translated: it is not a nature, just like the heat of water.

original: gal te me'i rang bzhin ni tsha ba nyid do zhes skye bo ba glang rdzi dang bud med yan chad la grags pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te me'i rang bzhin ni tsha ba nyid do zhes skye bo ba glang rdzi dang bud med yan chad la grags pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Isn’t it well known to everyone, from cowherds to women, that the nature of fire is heat?

original: ci kho bo cag gis ma grags so zhes smras sam /🔽'di ni rang bzhin yin par mi 'os te /
analyzed: ci kho bo cag gis ma grags so zhes smras sam / 'di ni rang bzhin yin par mi 'os te /
translated: Do we say that it is not well known?🔽We say that it is not suitable to be a nature

original: rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni kho bo cag smra'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni kho bo cag smra'o //
translated: because it lacks the characteristics of a nature.

original: ma rig pa'i phyin ci log gi @88b rjes su song ba'i phyir 'jig rten pas ni dngos po'i rnam pa rang bzhin med pa nyid la rang bzhin dang bcas pa nyid du rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i phyin ci log gi @88b rjes su song ba'i phyir 'jig rten pas ni dngos po'i rnam pa rang bzhin med pa nyid la rang bzhin dang bcas pa nyid du rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Because it is governed by the error of ignorance, worldly people think that the mode of being of things, which is essencelessness, has an essence.

original: ji ltar rab rib can rnams kyis skra shad la sogs pa rang bzhin med pa nyid la rab rib kyi rkyen gyis rang bzhin nyid du mngon par zhen pa de bzhin du byis pa rnams ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis blo gros kyi mig nyams pa nyid kyis
analyzed: ji ltar rab rib can rnams kyis skra shad la sogs pa rang bzhin med pa nyid la rab rib kyi rkyen gyis rang bzhin nyid du mngon par zhen pa de bzhin du byis pa rnams ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis blo gros kyi mig nyams pa nyid kyis
translated: Just as those with eye disease apprehend the absence of intrinsic reality in falling hairs and so on as having intrinsic reality due to the condition of eye disease, in the same way, childish beings, due to the impairment of the eye of intelligence by the eye disease of ignorance,🔽apprehend the aspect of things that lack intrinsic reality as having intrinsic reality.

original: dngos po'i rnam pa rang bzhin med pa la rang bzhin dang bcas pa nyid du mngon par zhen par gyur nas gzhan du ma dmigs pa las thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis me'i rang bzhin gyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni tsha ba'o zhes bya bar mngon par
analyzed: dngos po'i rnam pa rang bzhin med pa la rang bzhin dang bcas pa nyid du mngon par zhen par gyur nas gzhan du ma dmigs pa las thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis me'i rang bzhin gyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni tsha ba'o zhes bya bar mngon par
translated: Otherwise, due to the non-observation of anything else, they conceive the intrinsic identity of the nature of fire, which is heat, as its unique characteristic.

original: zhen pa ji lta ba bzhin du mtshan nyid smra ste /
analyzed: zhen pa ji lta ba bzhin du mtshan nyid smra ste /
translated: They speak of characteristics in accordance with that conception.

original: bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni rang gi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni rang gi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the intrinsic identity is the identity of itself.

original: de rnams la grags pa nyid kyi sgo nas /
analyzed: de rnams la grags pa nyid kyi sgo nas /
translated: From the perspective of what is renowned to them,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang chos mngon par de dag gi rang gi ngo bo kun rdzob pa de rnam par gzhag pa mdzad la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang chos mngon par de dag gi rang gi ngo bo kun rdzob pa de rnam par gzhag pa mdzad la /
translated: The Lord also, in the Abhidharma, has posited their conventional own nature.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa thun mong pa ni spyi'i mtshan nyid do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa thun mong pa ni spyi'i mtshan nyid do zhes bshad do //
translated: And impermanence and so forth, which are common to all, are the general characteristics.

original: gang gi tshe ma rig pa'i rab rib dang bral ba dri ma med pa'i shes rab kyi spyan mnga' ba rnams kyis gzigs pa la ltos nas ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ma rig pa'i rab rib dang bral ba dri ma med pa'i shes rab kyi spyan mnga' ba rnams kyis gzigs pa la ltos nas ni /
translated: But when the view of those who are free from the cataracts of ignorance, who possess the eye of stainless wisdom, is considered,🔽then, just as those free from cataracts do not see the hairs seen by those with cataracts, the noble ones, who do not see the nature imagined by the minds of foolish beings, clearly

original: de'i tshe rab rib dang bral ba dag gis rab rib can gyis dmigs pa'i skra shad ma mthong ba ltar 'phags pa byis pa'i skye bo'i blos brtags pa'i rang bzhin ma gzigs pa rnams kyis 'di ni dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ma yin no zhes gsal bar🔽gsungs par mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rab rib dang bral ba dag gis rab rib can gyis dmigs pa'i skra shad ma mthong ba ltar 'phags pa byis pa'i skye bo'i blos brtags pa'i rang bzhin ma gzigs pa rnams kyis 'di ni dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ma yin no zhes gsal bar gsungs par mdzad pa yin te /
translated: say, “This is not the nature of things.”

original: ji skad du 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las /🔽ji ltar rab rib can dag gis //
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las / ji ltar rab rib can dag gis //
translated: As it says in the noble Lankavatara-sutra:🔽Just as those with cataracts

original: skra shad log par 'dzin pa ltar //
analyzed: skra shad log par 'dzin pa ltar //
translated: perceive false hairs,

original: de bzhin dngos por rtog pa 'di //
analyzed: de bzhin dngos por rtog pa 'di //
translated: Likewise, this conception of entities

original: byis pas log par rnam par brtags //
analyzed: byis pas log par rnam par brtags //
translated: Is a false imagination of fools.

original: rang bzhin med cing rnam rig med //
analyzed: rang bzhin med cing rnam rig med //
translated: There is no intrinsic nature and no consciousness,

original: kun gzhi med cing dngos med na //
analyzed: kun gzhi med cing dngos med na //
translated: No all-base and no entities.

original: byis pa ngan pa rtog ge ba //
analyzed: byis pa ngan pa rtog ge ba //
translated: Fools, evil logicians,

original: ro dang 'dra bas 'di dag brtags //
analyzed: ro dang 'dra bas 'di dag brtags //
translated: Imagine these things, like corpses.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du blo gros chen po rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa la dgongs nas ngas chos thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes gsungs so zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du blo gros chen po rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa la dgongs nas ngas chos thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes gsungs so zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: And likewise, “Mahāmati, intending that things are not intrinsically produced, I have said that all things are unproduced.”

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: gal te me la sogs pa'i tsha ba nyid la sogs pa 'di rgyu dang rkyen las byung bas byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin ma yin no zhes smra na /
analyzed: gal te me la sogs pa'i tsha ba nyid la sogs pa 'di rgyu dang rkyen las byung bas byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin ma yin no zhes smra na /
translated: “If the heat of fire and so on arise from causes and conditions, they are produced and therefore not intrinsic nature.”

original: da ni @89a * //
analyzed: da ni @89a * //
translated: Now,

original: de dag gi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid gang yin zhing /
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid gang yin zhing /
translated: what is the defining characteristic of their intrinsic nature?

original: rang bzhin de yang gang zhig yin pa brjod dgos so //
analyzed: rang bzhin de yang gang zhig yin pa brjod dgos so //
translated: And what is that intrinsic nature? You must explain.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: rang bzhin dag ni bcos min dang // gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin //
analyzed: rang bzhin dag ni bcos min dang // gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin //
translated: Nature is not fabricated, nor does it depend on another.

original: 'di ni rang gi dngos po ni rang bzhin no zhes bya bas gang zhig dngos po gang gi bdag gi ba'i ngo bo yin pa de ni de'i rang bzhin yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ni rang gi dngos po ni rang bzhin no zhes bya bas gang zhig dngos po gang gi bdag gi ba'i ngo bo yin pa de ni de'i rang bzhin yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: Nature is the intrinsic nature of a thing. That which is the intrinsic nature of a thing is its nature.

original: gang zhig gang gi bdag gi ba yin zhe na //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi bdag gi ba yin zhe na //
translated: What is the intrinsic nature of what?

original: gang gis gang ma bcos pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis gang ma bcos pa'o //
translated: That which is not fabricated by anything else.

original: gang zhig bcos ma yin pa de ni de'i bdag gi ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig bcos ma yin pa de ni de'i bdag gi ba ma yin te /
translated: That which is fabricated is not the intrinsic nature of that.

original: dper na / chu'i tsha ba nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / chu'i tsha ba nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, the heat of water.

original: gang zhig gang la rag ma las pa de yang de'i bdag gi ba yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang la rag ma las pa de yang de'i bdag gi ba yin te /
translated: That which does not depend on another is also the intrinsic nature of that.

original: dper na / rang gi khol po dang rang gi nor dag bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / rang gi khol po dang rang gi nor dag bzhin no //
translated: For example, one’s own slave and one’s own wealth.

original: gang zhig gi gzhan la rag las pa gang yin pa de ni de'i bdag gi ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gi gzhan la rag las pa gang yin pa de ni de'i bdag gi ba ma yin te /
translated: That which depends on another is not the intrinsic nature of that.

original: dper na / re zhig pa'i brnyan por rang dbang med pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na / re zhig pa'i brnyan por rang dbang med pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a hired man is not the intrinsic nature of his wages.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar bcos ma dang rang la ltos pa rang bzhin nyid du mi 'dod pa de nyid kyi phyir tsha ba nyid me'i rang bzhin no zhes bya ba ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar bcos ma dang rang la ltos pa rang bzhin nyid du mi 'dod pa de nyid kyi phyir tsha ba nyid me'i rang bzhin no zhes bya ba ni mi rigs te /
translated: Because we do not assert that that which is fabricated and dependent on another is an essence, therefore it is illogical to say that heat is the essence of fire.

original: rgyu dang rkyen la rag las pa'i phyir dang / sngar ma byung ba las phyir 'byung bas byas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen la rag las pa'i phyir dang / sngar ma byung ba las phyir 'byung bas byas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it depends on causes and conditions and because it is produced from what did not exist previously.

original: gang gi phyir 'di de ltar yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di de ltar yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because this is so,

original: dus gsum du yang me la mi 'khrul pa gnyug ma'i ngo bo ma bcos pa /
analyzed: dus gsum du yang me la mi 'khrul pa gnyug ma'i ngo bo ma bcos pa /
translated: the unmistaken intrinsic nature of fire that exists in the three temporal periods is unfabricated.

original: gang zhig sngar ma byung ba las phyis 'byung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: gang zhig sngar ma byung ba las phyis 'byung ba ma yin pa /
translated: That which does not arise from what did not exist previously,

original: gang zhig chu'i tsha ba 'am /
analyzed: gang zhig chu'i tsha ba 'am /
translated: that which is not like the heat of water,

original: tshu rol dang pha rol lam /
analyzed: tshu rol dang pha rol lam /
translated: that which is not like this side and the other side,

original: ring po dang thung ngu ltar rgyu dang rkyen la ltos pa dang bcas par ma gyur pa gang yin pa de rang bzhin yin par brjod do //
analyzed: ring po dang thung ngu ltar rgyu dang rkyen la ltos pa dang bcas par ma gyur pa gang yin pa de rang bzhin yin par brjod do //
translated: that which is not like long and short, that which does not depend on causes and conditions, that is said to be an essence.

original: ci me'i rang gi ngo bo de lta bur gyur pa de yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci me'i rang gi ngo bo de lta bur gyur pa de yod dam zhe na /
translated: Does the intrinsic reality of fire exist in that way?

original: de ni rang gi ngo bos yod pa yang ma yin la med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni rang gi ngo bos yod pa yang ma yin la med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not essentially existent and it is not essentially nonexistent.

original: de lta yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de lta yin mod kyi /
translated: Although this is so,

original: 'on kyang nyan pa po rnams kyi skrag pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang nyan pa po rnams kyi skrag pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to eliminate the fear of listeners,

original: sgro btags nas kun rdzob tu de yod do zhes bya bar de smra'o //
analyzed: sgro btags nas kun rdzob tu de yod do zhes bya bar de smra'o //
translated: we say that it exists conventionally, having imputed it.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: As the Bhagavān said:

original: yi ge med pa'i chos la ni //
analyzed: yi ge med pa'i chos la ni //
translated: In the Dharma that is without letters,

original: nyan pa gang yin ston pa gang //
analyzed: nyan pa gang yin ston pa gang //
translated: what is listening and what is teaching?

original: sgro btags pa las yi ge med //
analyzed: sgro btags pa las yi ge med //
translated: From imputation, there are no letters,

original: de ni nyan zhing ston pa 'ang yin //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ni nyan zhing ston pa 'ang yin // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: and that is listening and teaching.

original: 'di nyid las kyang /🔽stong ngo zhes kyang mi brjod de //
analyzed: 'di nyid las kyang / stong ngo zhes kyang mi brjod de //
translated: And in this text it says:🔽Do not say “it is empty,”

original: mi stong zhes kyang mi bya zhing //
analyzed: mi stong zhes kyang mi bya zhing //
translated: do not say “it is not empty,”

original: gnyis dang gnyis min mi bya ste //
analyzed: gnyis dang gnyis min mi bya ste //
translated: do not say “it is both” or “it is neither,”

original: gdags @89b pa'i don du brjod par bya //
analyzed: gdags @89b pa'i don du brjod par bya //
translated: but say it for the purpose of designation.

original: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained.

original: gal te sgro btags pa las de yod do zhes brjod na /
analyzed: gal te sgro btags pa las de yod do zhes brjod na /
translated: If we say that it exists through imputation,

original: de ci 'dra ba zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ci 'dra ba zhig yin zhe na /
translated: what is it like?

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo ni chos rnams kyi chos nyid ces bya ba gang yin pa de nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo ni chos rnams kyi chos nyid ces bya ba gang yin pa de nyid yin no //
translated: Its intrinsic reality is that which is called the intrinsic reality of phenomena.

original: de nas chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di yang gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: de nas chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di yang gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is this intrinsic reality of phenomena?

original: chos rnams kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: It is the intrinsic reality of phenomena.

original: ngo bo 'di yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: ngo bo 'di yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is this intrinsic reality?

original: rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin no //
translated: It is their nature.

original: rang bzhin 'di yang gang yin //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'di yang gang yin //
translated: What is this nature?

original: stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid do //
translated: It is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid 'di yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid 'di yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is this emptiness?

original: rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: It is the absence of nature.

original: rang bzhin med pa 'di yang gang zhig yin /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa 'di yang gang zhig yin /
translated: What is this absence of nature?

original: de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid do //
translated: It is thusness.

original: de bzhin nyid 'di yang gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid 'di yang gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is this thusness?

original: de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo 'gyur ba med pa nyid dang / rtag tu gnas pa nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo 'gyur ba med pa nyid dang / rtag tu gnas pa nyid de /
translated: It is the unchanging intrinsic reality of thusness and its constant abiding.

original: rnam pa thams cad du skye ba med pa nyid ni bcos ma ma yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir me la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du skye ba med pa nyid ni bcos ma ma yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir me la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: Since it is not fabricated and does not depend on another, it is said to be the nature of fire and so on.

original: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /🔽dngos po'i rnam pa ma rig pa'i rab rib kyi mthus dmigs pa ni ma gzigs pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te / dngos po'i rnam pa ma rig pa'i rab rib kyi mthus dmigs pa ni ma gzigs pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: This is the way it is taught.

original: bdag nyid gang gis 'phags pa ma rig pa'i rab rib dang bral ba rnams kyi yul du 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag nyid gang gis 'phags pa ma rig pa'i rab rib dang bral ba rnams kyi yul du 'gyur te /
translated: The aspect of a thing that is perceived by the power of the eye disease of ignorance is not seen by the noble ones who are free from the eye disease of ignorance.

original: ngo bo de nyid de dag gi rang bzhin du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: ngo bo de nyid de dag gi rang bzhin du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The nature of the noble ones is the nature of things.

original: rang bzhin dag ni bcos min dang / gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin //
analyzed: rang bzhin dag ni bcos min dang / gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin //
translated: The nature of things is not fabricated and does not depend on another.

original: zhes bya ba 'di ni slob dpon dag gis de'i mtshan nyid du rnam par gzhag go zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ni slob dpon dag gis de'i mtshan nyid du rnam par gzhag go zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: This is how the masters have established its definition.

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa skye ba med pa de yang ci yang ma yin pa nyid kyis dngos po med pa tsam yin pas ngo bo med pa'i phyir dngos po'i rang bzhin du yod pa ma yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa skye ba med pa de yang ci yang ma yin pa nyid kyis dngos po med pa tsam yin pas ngo bo med pa'i phyir dngos po'i rang bzhin du yod pa ma yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: That non-arising which is the nature of things is just the absence of things, since it is nothing at all. Therefore, it should be understood that it does not exist as the nature of things, because it has no nature.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: As the Blessed One said:

original: gang gi dngos rnams dngos med shes pa ste //
analyzed: gang gi dngos rnams dngos med shes pa ste //
translated: One who knows that things are unreal

original: nang yang dngos po kun la chags mi 'gyur //
analyzed: nang yang dngos po kun la chags mi 'gyur //
translated: Will not be attached to anything internal.

original: gang zhig nam yang dngos kun chags med pa //
analyzed: gang zhig nam yang dngos kun chags med pa //
translated: One who is never attached to anything

original: de ni ting 'dzin mtshan ma med la reg / ces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ni ting 'dzin mtshan ma med la reg / ces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Will touch the signless meditative absorption.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: gal te yang dngos po rnams la rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa de lta na yang re zhig gzhan gyi dngos po ni yod de /
analyzed: gal te yang dngos po rnams la rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa de lta na yang re zhig gzhan gyi dngos po ni yod de /
translated: “Even though things do not have intrinsic nature, still other natures exist,

original: de ma bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not refuted.

original: gzhan gyi dngos po yod na ni rang bzhin yang yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po yod na ni rang bzhin yang yod par 'gyur te /
translated: If other natures exist, then intrinsic nature also exists,

original: rang bzhin med par gzhan gyi dngos po mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin med par gzhan gyi dngos po mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because without intrinsic nature, other natures are not established.”

original: brjod pa / rang bzhin med pa ma yin na //🔽gzhan @90a * //
analyzed: brjod pa / rang bzhin med pa ma yin na // gzhan @90a * //
translated: We reply:

original: gyi dngos po ga la yod //🔽gzhan gyi dngos po'i rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: gyi dngos po ga la yod // gzhan gyi dngos po'i rang bzhin ni //
translated: How can there be other natures🔽If there is no intrinsic nature?🔽The nature of other natures

original: gzhan gyi dngos po yin zhes brjod //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po yin zhes brjod //
translated: Is said to be other natures.

original: 'dir 'jig rten na ni rang bzhin 'ga' zhig kho na rang bzhin gzhan la ltos nas gzhan gyi dngos po zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir 'jig rten na ni rang bzhin 'ga' zhig kho na rang bzhin gzhan la ltos nas gzhan gyi dngos po zhes brjod do //
translated: In the world, it is said that “the state of being other” of some nature depends on another nature.

original: gal te tsha ba nyid me'i rang bzhin yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te tsha ba nyid me'i rang bzhin yin na ni /
translated: If heat were the nature of fire,

original: gsher ba'i rang bzhin can gyi tshu la ltos nas gzhan gyi dngos po zhes brjod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gsher ba'i rang bzhin can gyi tshu la ltos nas gzhan gyi dngos po zhes brjod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then it would be said to be “the state of being other” in dependence on water, which has the nature of wetness.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par dpyad pa na gang la yang rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe ni gzhan nyid yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par dpyad pa na gang la yang rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe ni gzhan nyid yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: But when one analyzes, if nothing has a nature, then how could being other exist?

original: gzhan nyid med pas ni rang bzhin yang yod pa ma yin par grub po //
analyzed: gzhan nyid med pas ni rang bzhin yang yod pa ma yin par grub po //
translated: Since being other does not exist, it is established that nature does not exist.

original: 'dir smras pa ;
analyzed: 'dir smras pa ;
translated: Here, someone might say:

original: gal te yang rang bzhin dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag yod pa ma yin pa de lta na yang dngos po ni re zhig yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te yang rang bzhin dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag yod pa ma yin pa de lta na yang dngos po ni re zhig yod pa yin te /
translated: Even though nature and the state of being other do not exist, still things do exist.

original: ma bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are not refuted.

original: dngos po de yod na yang rang bzhin nam gzhan gyi dngos po zhig tu 'gyur dgos te /
analyzed: dngos po de yod na yang rang bzhin nam gzhan gyi dngos po zhig tu 'gyur dgos te /
translated: If things exist, then they must be either nature or the state of being other.

original: de'i phyir / rang bzhin dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag kyang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rang bzhin dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag kyang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, intrinsic reality and extrinsic reality would also exist.🔽In response, Aryadeva says:🔽Apart from intrinsic reality and extrinsic reality,

original: brjod pa / rang bzhin dang ni gzhan dngos dag / ma gtogs dngos po ga la yod //
analyzed: brjod pa / rang bzhin dang ni gzhan dngos dag / ma gtogs dngos po ga la yod //
translated: how can there be an entity?🔽If intrinsic reality and extrinsic reality exist,

original: rang bzhin dang ni gzhan dngos dag / yod na dngos po 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang ni gzhan dngos dag / yod na dngos po 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: an entity would be established.

original: 'di ltar dngos po brtags pa na /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po brtags pa na /
translated: When an entity is investigated,

original: rang bzhin nam gzhan gyi dngos po zhig yin grang /
analyzed: rang bzhin nam gzhan gyi dngos po zhig yin grang /
translated: is it intrinsic reality or extrinsic reality?

original: de gnyis kyang sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis kyang sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Those two do not exist in the way described earlier.

original: de'i phyir de gnyis med pas dngos po yang yod pa ma yin no zhes nges par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de gnyis med pas dngos po yang yod pa ma yin no zhes nges par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should ascertain that because those two do not exist, an entity also does not exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might argue as follows:

original: gal te yang khyod kyis dngos po bkag mod kyi /🔽de lta na yang dngos po med pa ni yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: gal te yang khyod kyis dngos po bkag mod kyi / de lta na yang dngos po med pa ni yod pa nyid de /
translated: “Although you have refuted entities,

original: ma bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: nonentities exist because they are not refuted.

original: de'i phyir 'gal zla yod pas //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gal zla yod pas //
translated: Therefore, because their opposite exists,

original: dngos po yang yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po yang yod par 'gyur te /
translated: entities also exist

original: dngos po med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa bzhin no //
translated: because nonentities exist.”

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We respond:

original: gal te dngos po med pa nyid yod na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po med pa nyid yod na /
translated: If non-entity itself existed,

original: dngos po yang yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: dngos po yang yod par 'gyur na /
translated: entity would also exist.

original: yod pa ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: yod pa ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa /
translated: But it does not exist.

original: gal te dngos po ma grub na //
analyzed: gal te dngos po ma grub na //
translated: If entity is not established,

original: dngos med 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //🔽dngos po gzhan du gyur pa ni ;
analyzed: dngos med 'grub par mi 'gyur ro // dngos po gzhan du gyur pa ni ;
translated: non-entity is not established.🔽People say that the transformation of entity

original: ; dngos med yin par skye bo smra //
analyzed: ; dngos med yin par skye bo smra //
translated: is non-entity.

original: 'di na gal te dngos po zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na ni /
analyzed: 'di na gal te dngos po zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na ni /
translated: If something called “entity” existed here,

original: de gzhan du gyur pa las dngos po med par 'gyur ba zhig ste /
analyzed: de gzhan du gyur pa las dngos po med par 'gyur ba zhig ste /
translated: it would become non-entity through transformation.

original: 'di ltar bum pa la sogs pa da ltar gyi gnas skabs las nyams shing /
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa la sogs pa da ltar gyi gnas skabs las nyams shing /
translated: For example, when a pot and so on is damaged and

original: gzhan du gyur pa thob pa dag ni 'jig rten @90b na dngos po med pa'i sgra'i brjod byar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa thob pa dag ni 'jig rten @90b na dngos po med pa'i sgra'i brjod byar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: its present state is transformed, people say that it is the expression of the word “non-entity.”

original: gang gi tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe /
translated: But if entity does not exist,🔽how could non-entity exist?

original: bum pa la sogs pa 'di dag dngos po'i ngo bo nyid du ma grub pa de'i tshe yod pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can rnams la gzhan du 'gyur pa nyid yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa 'di dag dngos po'i ngo bo nyid du ma grub pa de'i tshe yod pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can rnams la gzhan du 'gyur pa nyid yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: If these things, such as a vase, are not established as the entity of things, then how could they have a nature that does not exist and transformation into another?

original: de'i phyir dngos po med pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po med pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, nonthings also do not exist.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rnam pa thams cad du rang bzhin dang gzhan gyi dngos po dang / dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag yod pa ma yin pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rnam pa thams cad du rang bzhin dang gzhan gyi dngos po dang / dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag yod pa ma yin pa la /
translated: Thus, in every way, intrinsic reality, extrinsic reality, things, and nonthings do not exist.

original: ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis blo gros kyi mig nyams pa nyid kyis phyin ci log tu /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis blo gros kyi mig nyams pa nyid kyis phyin ci log tu /
translated: Those whose eyes of intelligence are impaired by the cataracts of ignorance see them as erroneous.🔽Those who see intrinsic reality, extrinsic reality,

original: gang dag rang bzhin gzhan dngos dang // dngos dang dngos med nyid lta ba //🔽de dag sangs rgyas bstan pa la //
analyzed: gang dag rang bzhin gzhan dngos dang // dngos dang dngos med nyid lta ba // de dag sangs rgyas bstan pa la //
translated: Things, and nonthings🔽Do not see the truth

original: de nyid mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: In the teaching of the Buddha.

original: gang dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab phyin ci ma log bar rnam par 'chad par rlom pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: gang dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab phyin ci ma log bar rnam par 'chad par rlom pa nyid kyis /
translated: Those who, through their own conceit, claim to explain the scriptures of the Tathāgata without error

original: sa'i rang bzhin ni sra ba'o //
analyzed: sa'i rang bzhin ni sra ba'o //
translated: The nature of earth is solidity.

original: tshor ba'i ni yul myong ba'o //
analyzed: tshor ba'i ni yul myong ba'o //
translated: The nature of feeling is the experience of objects.🔽The nature of consciousness is the discernment of objects.🔽Thus, they speak of the nature of things.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin ni yul so sor rnam par rig pa'o zhes de ltar dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin smra ba dang / gzugs gzhan la rnam par shes pa yang gzhan yin zhing /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin ni yul so sor rnam par rig pa'o zhes de ltar dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin smra ba dang / gzugs gzhan la rnam par shes pa yang gzhan yin zhing /
translated: They speak of the otherness of things, saying that form is one thing and consciousness is another,🔽and that feeling is something else.

original: tshor ba yang gzhan nyid do zhes de ltar gzhan gyi dngos po smra ba dang / rnam par shes pa la sogs pa da ltar ba'i gnas skabs su gyur pa dngos por ram /
analyzed: tshor ba yang gzhan nyid do zhes de ltar gzhan gyi dngos po smra ba dang / rnam par shes pa la sogs pa da ltar ba'i gnas skabs su gyur pa dngos por ram /
translated: They speak of the nonexistence of things, saying that consciousness and so on, in the present state, are things,🔽but that consciousness and so on, in the past state, are nonthings.

original: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'das par gyur pa dngos po med par smra ba de dag ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mchog tu zab pa'i de kho na nyid smra ba ma yin no //🔽gang gi phyir /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'das par gyur pa dngos po med par smra ba de dag ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mchog tu zab pa'i de kho na nyid smra ba ma yin no // gang gi phyir /
translated: They do not speak of the supreme profundity of dependent origination.

original: rang bzhin dang gzhan gyi dngos po la sogs pa rnams yod pa nyid ni ji skad bshad pa'i 'thad pa dang 'gal ba yin la /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang gzhan gyi dngos po la sogs pa rnams yod pa nyid ni ji skad bshad pa'i 'thad pa dang 'gal ba yin la /
translated: Because the existence of intrinsic nature, extrinsic nature, and so on, is contradicted by the reasoning explained above.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni dngos po'i rang bzhin 'thad pa dang 'gal ba gsung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni dngos po'i rang bzhin 'thad pa dang 'gal ba gsung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: The Tathagatas do not speak in contradiction to the nature of things,

original: rang nyid kyi dngos po ma lus pa'i de nyid phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid kyi dngos po ma lus pa'i de nyid phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have unmistakenly realized the reality of all things.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: mkhas pa dag ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kho na'i gsung tshad mar rjod par byed de /
analyzed: mkhas pa dag ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kho na'i gsung tshad mar rjod par byed de /
translated: the wise declare only the speech of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, to be a valid means of knowledge,

original: 'thad pa dang bcas pas mi slu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'thad pa dang bcas pas mi slu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is non-deceptive, being in accord with what is reasonable.

original: de nyid kyi phyir nyes pa ma lus pa spangs pa yid ches ba dag las 'ongs pa'i phyir ram //🔽kun du go bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nyes pa ma lus pa spangs pa yid ches ba dag las 'ongs pa'i phyir ram // kun du go bar byed pa ste /
translated: For this very reason, it is the source of what is trusted, because it is free from all faults,🔽or it is the means of understanding,

original: de kho na nyid kun nas go bar byed pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kun nas go bar byed pa'i phyir ram /
translated: because it causes the understanding of reality,

original: mngon du phyogs nas 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: mngon du phyogs nas 'gro ba ste /
translated: or it is the path that leads to the goal,

original: @91a * // de la brten nas 'jig rten pa mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i phyir rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gsung nyid lung du rnam par gzhag la /
analyzed: @91a * // de la brten nas 'jig rten pa mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i phyir rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gsung nyid lung du rnam par gzhag la /
translated: because it leads to nirvana for the world, based on it. Thus, only the speech of the perfect Buddha is established as scripture.

original: de las gzhan gyi gzhung lugs rnams ni 'thad pa dang bral bas tshad ma ma yin pa nyid dang lung ma yin pa nyid du rnam par gzhag go //🔽gang gi phyir /
analyzed: de las gzhan gyi gzhung lugs rnams ni 'thad pa dang bral bas tshad ma ma yin pa nyid dang lung ma yin pa nyid du rnam par gzhag go // gang gi phyir /
translated: The other systems are not valid cognitions, and are not scriptures, because they are not tenable.

original: rang bzhin dang gzhan gyi dngos po dang / dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba 'di dag rigs pa dang bral bas de kho na nyid ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang gzhan gyi dngos po dang / dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba 'di dag rigs pa dang bral bas de kho na nyid ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because these views of intrinsic reality, extrinsic reality, existence, and nonexistence are not tenable,

original: gdul bya'i skye bo thar pa 'dod pa rnams la /🔽bcom ldan dngos dang dngos med pa //
analyzed: gdul bya'i skye bo thar pa 'dod pa rnams la / bcom ldan dngos dang dngos med pa //
translated: the Lord Buddha, for the sake of disciples who desire liberation,🔽taught the middle way🔽that is free from existence and nonexistence.

original: mkhyen pas k'a ta yan yi //
analyzed: mkhyen pas k'a ta yan yi //
translated: The Lord Buddha, who knows existence and nonexistence,🔽in the Advice to Kātyāyana Sūtra,

original: gdams ngag las ni yod pa dang // med pa gnyi ga 'ang dgag par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: gdams ngag las ni yod pa dang // med pa gnyi ga 'ang dgag par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: refuted both existence and nonexistence.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis k'a ta yan la gdams pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis k'a ta yan la gdams pa'i mdo las /
translated: The Advice to Kātyāyana Sūtra says:

original: k'a ta yan gang gi phyir 'jig rten 'di ni phal cher yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid la mngon par zhen te /
analyzed: k'a ta yan gang gi phyir 'jig rten 'di ni phal cher yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid la mngon par zhen te /
translated: “Kātyāyana, because the world is mostly attached to existence and nonexistence,

original: des na skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba dang mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrugs pa dag las yongs su grol bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: des na skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba dang mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrugs pa dag las yongs su grol bar mi 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, one will not be liberated from birth, aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and agitation.

original: 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba las grol bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba las grol bar mi 'gyur /
translated: One will not be liberated from the five destinies of cyclic existence.

original: 'chi ba'i gdung ba'i sdug bsngal las grol bar mi 'gyur zhes rgya cher gsungs pa yin la /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i gdung ba'i sdug bsngal las grol bar mi 'gyur zhes rgya cher gsungs pa yin la /
translated: One will not be liberated from the suffering of the torment of death.

original: mdo sde 'di yang sde ba thams cad kyis 'don pa yin no //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di yang sde ba thams cad kyis 'don pa yin no //
translated: This sūtra is recited by all schools.

original: de'i phyir lung 'di dang ji skad bshad pa'i rigs pa las na shes rab can gyi rang bzhin dang / gzhan gyi dngos po dang / dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' dang shin tu 'gal ba khas blang bar 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir lung 'di dang ji skad bshad pa'i rigs pa las na shes rab can gyi rang bzhin dang / gzhan gyi dngos po dang / dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' dang shin tu 'gal ba khas blang bar 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, because of this scripture and the reasoning explained above, it is not suitable to accept that the nature of the wise, the nature of others, and the views of entity and nonentity are in complete contradiction to the words of the Tathāgata

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Bhagavat refuted them.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis khyad par du 'phags pa zhig gis she na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis khyad par du 'phags pa zhig gis she na /
translated: But why is the Lord superior?

original: dngos dang dngos med mkhyen pas te /🔽'di la dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag mkhyen pa'i ngang tshul mnga' bas na /
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med mkhyen pas te / 'di la dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag mkhyen pa'i ngang tshul mnga' bas na /
translated: Because he knows things and nonthings.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa mkhyen pa'o //🔽dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ji ltar gnas pa bzhin phyin ci ma log par yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa mkhyen pa'o // dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ji ltar gnas pa bzhin phyin ci ma log par yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir /
translated: He is the knower of things and nonthings because he has the nature of knowing things and nonthings.

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid dngos po dang dngos po med pa mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //🔽gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das dngos po dang dngos po med pa mkhyen pa des yod pa dang med pa nyid gnyi ga yang dgag @91b pa mdzad pa de'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba de kho na nyid yin no zhes khas blangs par
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid dngos po dang dngos po med pa mkhyen pa zhes bya'o // gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das dngos po dang dngos po med pa mkhyen pa des yod pa dang med pa nyid gnyi ga yang dgag @91b pa mdzad pa de'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba de kho na nyid yin no zhes khas blangs par
translated: The Lord himself is called the knower of things and nonthings because he knows things and nonthings just as they are, without error.

original: rigs pa ma yin no //🔽de bzhin du /
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin no //🔽de bzhin du /
translated: Since the Lord is the knower of things and nonthings, he refutes both existence and nonexistence. Therefore, it is not reasonable to maintain that the views of things and nonthings are reality.🔽Since the Lord is the knower of things and nonthings, he refutes both existence and nonexistence. Therefore, it is not reasonable to maintain that the views of things and nonthings are reality.

original: 'od srungs yod ces bya ba 'di ni mtha' gcig go //
analyzed: 'od srungs yod ces bya ba 'di ni mtha' gcig go //
translated: Kāśyapa, “existence” is one extreme.

original: med ces bya ba 'di ni mtha' gnyis so //
analyzed: med ces bya ba 'di ni mtha' gnyis so //
translated: “Nonexistence” is a second extreme.

original: de gnyis kyi dbus gang yin pa de ni dpyad du med pa /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi dbus gang yin pa de ni dpyad du med pa /
translated: The middle between these two is not investigated,

original: bstan du med pa /
analyzed: bstan du med pa /
translated: not demonstrated,

original: rten ma yin pa /
analyzed: rten ma yin pa /
translated: not a support,

original: snang ba med pa /
analyzed: snang ba med pa /
translated: not manifest,

original: rnam par rig pa med pa /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa med pa /
translated: not a cognition,

original: gnas pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gnas pa med pa ste /
translated: and not a location.🔽Kāśyapa, this is called the middle way, the thorough analysis of phenomena.

original: 'od srungs 'di ni dbu ma'i lam chos rnams la so sor rtog pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di ni dbu ma'i lam chos rnams la so sor rtog pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly,

original: yod dang med ces bya ba gnyi ga mtha' //
analyzed: yod dang med ces bya ba gnyi ga mtha' //
translated: “Existence” and “nonexistence” are both extremes.

original: gtsang dang mi gtsang 'di yang mtha' yin te //
analyzed: gtsang dang mi gtsang 'di yang mtha' yin te //
translated: “Pure” and “impure” are also extremes.

original: de phyir gnyi ga'i mtha' ni rnam spangs nas //
analyzed: de phyir gnyi ga'i mtha' ni rnam spangs nas //
translated: Therefore, having abandoned both extremes,

original: mkhas pas dbus la'ang gnas par yod mi byed //
analyzed: mkhas pas dbus la'ang gnas par yod mi byed //
translated: the learned do not abide even in the middle.

original: yod dang med ces bya ba rtsod pa ste //
analyzed: yod dang med ces bya ba rtsod pa ste //
translated: “Existence” and “nonexistence” are disputes.

original: gtsang dang mi gtsang 'di yang rtsod pa yin //
analyzed: gtsang dang mi gtsang 'di yang rtsod pa yin //
translated: “Pure” and “impure” are also disputes.

original: rtsod par gyur pa'i sdug bsngal zhi mi 'gyur //
analyzed: rtsod par gyur pa'i sdug bsngal zhi mi 'gyur //
translated: Disputes do not pacify the suffering of existence.

original: rtsod pa med par gyur pas sdug bsngal 'gag / ces gsungs so //
analyzed: rtsod pa med par gyur pas sdug bsngal 'gag / ces gsungs so //
translated: Since there is no dispute, suffering ceases.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say:

original: gal te yang de ltar me la sogs pa rang bzhin kho nas yod pa nyid du gyur na nyes pa cir 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te yang de ltar me la sogs pa rang bzhin kho nas yod pa nyid du gyur na nyes pa cir 'gyur /
translated: If fire and so on existed essentially, what fault would there be?🔽We have already explained the fault using such passages as:

original: rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba yi //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba yi //
translated: That which arises from causes and conditions

original: rang bzhin byas pa can du 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: rang bzhin byas pa can du 'gyur // zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes pa bshad zin to //
translated: Would be a product.

original: gzhan yang / gal te me la sogs pa 'di dag gi rang bzhin 'di nyid yod pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te me la sogs pa 'di dag gi rang bzhin 'di nyid yod pa yin na ni /
translated: Moreover, if the essence of these things, such as fire, existed,

original: yod par gyur pa de yang gzhan du gyur pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yod par gyur pa de yang gzhan du gyur pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: then that which exists would not become something else. In order to demonstrate this, it is said:

original: gal te rang bzhin gyis yod na //
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin gyis yod na //
translated: If it existed essentially,

original: de ni med nyid mi 'gyur ro //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni med nyid mi 'gyur ro // zhes gsungs te /
translated: It could not become nonexistent.

original: gal te 'di nyid me la sogs pa 'di dag gi rang bzhin te rang gi ngo bo yin par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'di nyid me la sogs pa 'di dag gi rang bzhin te rang gi ngo bo yin par gyur na ni /
translated: If this were the essence, or intrinsic nature, of these things, such as fire,

original: de'i tshe rang bzhin gyis yod pa'i rang bzhin de la slar yang gzhan du 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: de'i tshe rang bzhin gyis yod pa'i rang bzhin de la slar yang gzhan du 'gyur ba med de /
translated: then that essence, which exists essentially, could not become something else.

original: gang gi phyir /🔽rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba ni //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba ni //
translated: Because🔽it is never tenable

original: nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: that an essence transforms.

original: gal te 'di nyid me la sogs pa 'di dag gi rang bzhin yin par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'di nyid me la sogs pa 'di dag gi rang bzhin yin par gyur na ni /
translated: If this were the essence of these things such as fire,

original: de'i tshe rang bzhin ni mi 'gyur ba nyid yin pa'i phyir nam yang gzhan du 'gyur bar 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe rang bzhin ni mi 'gyur ba nyid yin pa'i phyir nam yang gzhan du 'gyur bar 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: then it would never be tenable that it transforms into something else, because an essence does not change.

original: nam mkha'i mi sgrib pa nyid nam yang gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin pa de bzhin du me la sogs pa rang bzhin gyis yod pa dag kyang slar gzhan du mi 'gyur ba zhig na /🔽de dag gzhan du 'gyur ba rgyun chad pa'i mtshan nyid @92a * //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mi sgrib pa nyid nam yang gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin pa de bzhin du me la sogs pa rang bzhin gyis yod pa dag kyang slar gzhan du mi 'gyur ba zhig na / de dag gzhan du 'gyur ba rgyun chad pa'i mtshan nyid @92a * //
translated: Just as the nonobstructive quality of space never transforms into something else, so too, if fire and so on existed essentially, they would not transform into something else.

original: can gyi 'jig pa ni khyod kyis dmigs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: can gyi 'jig pa ni khyod kyis dmigs pa yang yin no //
translated: But you observe the destruction of these things, which is characterized by their transformation into something else.

original: de'i phyir rnam par 'gyur ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir chu'i tsha ba nyid ltar 'di 'di dag gi rang bzhin ma yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par 'gyur ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir chu'i tsha ba nyid ltar 'di 'di dag gi rang bzhin ma yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, like the heat of water, it should be understood that this is not their essence because it is a phenomenon that changes.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say:

original: gal te rang bzhin gyis yod pa la gzhan du 'gyur pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyang dmigs pa'i phyir dngos po 'di dag la rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod na /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin gyis yod pa la gzhan du 'gyur pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyang dmigs pa'i phyir dngos po 'di dag la rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod na /
translated: If you say that since intrinsic reality does not transform, and since transformation is observed, these things do not have intrinsic reality,

original: de lta na yang /
analyzed: de lta na yang /
translated: then in response to that we say:

original: rang bzhin yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: rang bzhin yod pa ma yin na //
translated: Intrinsic reality does not exist.

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba gang gi yin //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba gang gi yin //
translated: What transforms?

original: da ni nam mkha'i me tog ltar rang bzhin te rang gi ngo bos yod pa ma yin pas gzhan du 'gyur ba gang gi yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: da ni nam mkha'i me tog ltar rang bzhin te rang gi ngo bos yod pa ma yin pas gzhan du 'gyur ba gang gi yin par 'gyur /
translated: Since it does not exist through its intrinsic reality, like a flower in the sky, what transforms?

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa la gzhan du 'gyur ba ma dmigs pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa la gzhan du 'gyur ba ma dmigs pa'i phyir la /
translated: Therefore, since transformation is not observed in that which does not have intrinsic reality,

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyang mthong ba'i phyir rang bzhin yod do //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyang mthong ba'i phyir rang bzhin yod do //
translated: and since transformation itself is seen, intrinsic reality exists.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We respond:

original: gal te khyod kyi lugs kyis rang bzhin te rang gi ngo bos yod pa ma yin pa la gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: gal te khyod kyi lugs kyis rang bzhin te rang gi ngo bos yod pa ma yin pa la gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir la /
translated: If in your system intrinsic reality, that is, existence through its own entity, does not exist, then transformation does not exist.

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba yang mthong ba'i phyir rang bzhin yod do zhes smra ba yin na ni /
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba yang mthong ba'i phyir rang bzhin yod do zhes smra ba yin na ni /
translated: But if you say that because we see transformation, things have essence,

original: de lta na yang rang bzhin yod pa ma yin na yang gzhan du 'gyur ba ji ltar rung /
analyzed: de lta na yang rang bzhin yod pa ma yin na yang gzhan du 'gyur ba ji ltar rung /
translated: then even though things do not have essence, how could they transform?

original: da ni da ltar byung ba ltar rang bzhin te rang gi ngo bos yod pa'i phyir gzhan du 'gyur ba gang gi yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: da ni da ltar byung ba ltar rang bzhin te rang gi ngo bos yod pa'i phyir gzhan du 'gyur ba gang gi yin par 'gyur /
translated: Now, since it exists essentially, that is, by way of its own entity, how could it transform?

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin gyis yod pa la gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gzhan du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad du mi srid pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin gyis yod pa la gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gzhan du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad du mi srid pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since transformation does not exist for that which exists essentially, transformation is impossible in any way.

original: de'i phyir dngos po rnams la rang bzhin med do zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rnams la rang bzhin med do zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should understand that things do not have essence.

original: gang yang gzhan du 'gyur ba mthong ba'i phyir rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa de yang gzhan la grags pa'i gzhan du 'gyur ba mthong ba'i dbang du byas nas brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang yang gzhan du 'gyur ba mthong ba'i phyir rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa de yang gzhan la grags pa'i gzhan du 'gyur ba mthong ba'i dbang du byas nas brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: But if you say that because we see transformation, things do not have essence, this is stated from the perspective of the transformation of other things that is accepted by others.

original: kho bo cag gis nam yang gang la yang gzhan du 'gyur ba yod par khas ma blangs so //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis nam yang gang la yang gzhan du 'gyur ba yod par khas ma blangs so //
translated: We never accept that anything is ever transformed into something else.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rang bzhin gtan yod pa ma yin dang / chos thams cad yod pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa dang / de dag la gzhan du 'gyur ba yang yod pa ma yin bzhin du /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rang bzhin gtan yod pa ma yin dang / chos thams cad yod pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa dang / de dag la gzhan du 'gyur ba yang yod pa ma yin bzhin du /
translated: Therefore, since intrinsic reality is definitely nonexistent in this way, and since all phenomena are by nature nonexistent, and since they are not transformed into something else,

original: da lta gang zhig dngos po rnams yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du rtog par byed de /
analyzed: da lta gang zhig dngos po rnams yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du rtog par byed de /
translated: what is the point of thinking that things exist or do not exist?

original: de ltar rtog pa de la ni nges pa kho nar /
analyzed: de ltar rtog pa de la ni nges pa kho nar /
translated: For those who think in this way, it follows that they🔽are definitely

original: @92b yod ces bya ba rtag par 'dzin //
analyzed: @92b yod ces bya ba rtag par 'dzin //
translated: grasping permanence when saying “exists,”🔽and

original: med ces bya ba chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med ces bya ba chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they are grasping annihilation when saying “does not exist.”

original: gang gi phyir rtag ba dang chad par lta ba 'di yang mtho ris dang byang grol gyi lam gyi bar du gcod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir don ma yin pa chen po byed pa /🔽de phyir yod dang med pa la //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtag ba dang chad par lta ba 'di yang mtho ris dang byang grol gyi lam gyi bar du gcod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir don ma yin pa chen po byed pa / de phyir yod dang med pa la //
translated: Because these views of permanence and annihilation are also obstacles to the path of high rebirth and liberation, they create great misfortune.🔽Therefore, the wise do not

original: mkhas pas gnas pas mi bya'o //
analyzed: mkhas pas gnas pas mi bya'o //
translated: dwell on existence or nonexistence.

original: yang ci'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba yod na rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba yod na rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Again, why does it follow that if one has the views of entity and nonentity, then one has the views of eternalism and nihilism?🔽It is like this:

original: 'di ltar / gang zhig rang bzhin gyis yod pa //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gang zhig rang bzhin gyis yod pa //
translated: If something exists essentially,🔽then since it could not become nonexistent,

original: de ni med pa yin pas rtag / sngon byung da ltar med ces pa //🔽des na chad par thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni med pa yin pas rtag / sngon byung da ltar med ces pa // des na chad par thal bar 'gyur //
translated: it would be permanent.

original: gang zhig rang bzhin gyis yod par brjod pa de ni rang bzhin la ldog pa med pas nam yang med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig rang bzhin gyis yod par brjod pa de ni rang bzhin la ldog pa med pas nam yang med pa ma yin te /
translated: If something is said to exist essentially, then since it could not become nonexistent, it would never become nonexistent.

original: de ltar na rang bzhin yod pa nyid du khas blangs pas rtag par lta bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar na rang bzhin yod pa nyid du khas blangs pas rtag par lta bar 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, since one would accept that it exists essentially, one would have the view of eternalism.

original: sngon gnas pa'i gnas skabs su /
analyzed: sngon gnas pa'i gnas skabs su /
translated: If one accepts that an entity exists essentially in the earlier phase,

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin khas blangs nas da ltar phyis de zhig pas med do zhes khas blangs pas chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin khas blangs nas da ltar phyis de zhig pas med do zhes khas blangs pas chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and later, when it has disintegrated, accepts that it does not exist, one would have the view of nihilism.

original: gang gi ltar na dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid mi 'thad pa de la ni rtag pa dang / chad par lta bar thal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi ltar na dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid mi 'thad pa de la ni rtag pa dang / chad par lta bar thal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: For those for whom the intrinsic reality of things is not tenable, the views of eternalism and nihilism do not follow.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the intrinsic reality of things is not observed.

original: gal te dngos po rnams rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no zhes khas len pa la dngos por lta ba med pas rtag par lta ba med mod /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no zhes khas len pa la dngos por lta ba med pas rtag par lta ba med mod /
translated: If one accepts that things do not intrinsically exist, then since they do not view things as existent, they do not have the view of eternalism.

original: chad par lta bar thal bar ni nges par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: chad par lta bar thal bar ni nges par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But does it not definitely follow that they have the view of nihilism?

original: de ltar med par lta bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar med par lta bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They do not have such a view.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig sngar dngos po'i rang bzhin khas blangs nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig sngar dngos po'i rang bzhin khas blangs nas /
translated: This is because those who previously assert the intrinsic reality of things

original: phyis de ldog pa la rten par byed pa de ni dngos po'i rang bzhin sngar dmigs pa la skur ba btab pas med par lta bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: phyis de ldog pa la rten par byed pa de ni dngos po'i rang bzhin sngar dmigs pa la skur ba btab pas med par lta bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: and later rely on its reversal would have the view of nihilism because they would be deprecating the previously observed intrinsic reality of things.

original: gang zhig rab rib can gyis dmigs pa'i skra shad dag la rab rib med pa ltar gyur cing ci yang ma dmigs pa des med do zhes smras pa na /
analyzed: gang zhig rab rib can gyis dmigs pa'i skra shad dag la rab rib med pa ltar gyur cing ci yang ma dmigs pa des med do zhes smras pa na /
translated: When someone who is free of myodesopsia, like someone without myodesopsia, does not see any floating hairs at all, he says, “They do not exist.”

original: ci zhig med par smras par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci zhig med par smras par 'gyur te /
translated: What does he say does not exist?

original: dgag bya med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgag bya med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object of negation does not exist.

original: phyin ci log tu gyur pa rnams log par mngon par zhen pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir rab rib med pa rnams ltar dngos po thams cad yod pa ma ma yin no zhes kho bo cag smra mod kyi /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu gyur pa rnams log par mngon par zhen pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir rab rib med pa rnams ltar dngos po thams cad yod pa ma ma yin no zhes kho bo cag smra mod kyi /
translated: We say that all things do not exist, just like those without myodesopsia, in order to stop those who have myodesopsia from wrongly adhering to things.

original: de skad smras pa na /
analyzed: de skad smras pa na /
translated: When we say this,

original: kho bo cag chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: we do not incur the fallacy of nihilism.

original: ji skad du mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las /
translated: As a sūtra says:

original: bcom ldan 'das @93a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das @93a * //
translated: Bhagavan,

original: gang gis sngar 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dag dngos por g-yar gyis blangs nas /
analyzed: gang gis sngar 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dag dngos por g-yar gyis blangs nas /
translated: those who previously took desire, anger, and ignorance to be things

original: phyis 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dag dngos po yod pa ni ma yin no zhes smra ba de ni med pa par yang 'gyur lags so zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: phyis 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dag dngos po yod pa ni ma yin no zhes smra ba de ni med pa par yang 'gyur lags so zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: You are a nihilist.

original: gang zhig gzhan dbang sems dang sems las byung ba dngos po tsam khas blangs nas /
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan dbang sems dang sems las byung ba dngos po tsam khas blangs nas /
translated: Someone might say, “Having accepted the mere things of dependent nature, mind and mental factors,

original: de la kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med pas yod par lta ba nyid spong zhing gzhan gyi dbang gi dngos po kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i rgyur gyur pa tsam zhig yod pas ni med par lta ba nyid spong bar byed pa
analyzed: de la kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med pas yod par lta ba nyid spong zhing gzhan gyi dbang gi dngos po kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i rgyur gyur pa tsam zhig yod pas ni med par lta ba nyid spong bar byed pa
translated: you abandon the view of existence by the nonexistence of the imagined nature and you abandon the view of nonexistence by the mere existence of the dependent nature that is the cause of affliction and purification.

original: de'i ltar na /
analyzed: de'i ltar na /
translated: In that case,

original: kun tu brtags pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyi dbang yod pa'i phyir yod pa dang med pa nyid du lta ba gnyi gar yang 'gyur ba'i phyir mtha' gnyis spangs par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: kun tu brtags pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyi dbang yod pa'i phyir yod pa dang med pa nyid du lta ba gnyi gar yang 'gyur ba'i phyir mtha' gnyis spangs par ga la 'gyur /
translated: since the imagined does not exist and the dependent exists, how could you abandon the two extremes, since you would have both the view of existence and the view of nonexistence?

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa ni rang bzhin dang bcas pa nyid du yod par mi rigs par bstan zin pa'i phyir bshad pa mi rigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa ni rang bzhin dang bcas pa nyid du yod par mi rigs par bstan zin pa'i phyir bshad pa mi rigs pa nyid do //
translated: It is not tenable to say that what is produced by causes and conditions has intrinsic reality, because it has already been demonstrated that it is not tenable.

original: de'i phyir de ltar dbu ma pa'i lta ba kho na la yod pa dang med pa nyid du lta bar thal ba med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar dbu ma pa'i lta ba kho na la yod pa dang med pa nyid du lta bar thal ba med pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, in this way, only the Madhyamaka view is free from the consequence of the views of existence and nonexistence.

original: rnam par shes par smra ba'i lta ba la sogs pa dag la ni ma yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes par smra ba'i lta ba la sogs pa dag la ni ma yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the views of the Vātsīputrīyas and so on are not.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this reason,

original: rin po che'i phreng ba las /🔽gang zag phung por smra ba yi //
analyzed: rin po che'i phreng ba las / gang zag phung por smra ba yi //
translated: the Precious Garland says:🔽If you ask the world, the Saṃkhyas, the Aulūkyas,

original: 'jig rten grangs can 'ug phrug dang // gos med bcas la gal te zhig / yod med 'das pa smra na dris //
analyzed: 'jig rten grangs can 'ug phrug dang // gos med bcas la gal te zhig / yod med 'das pa smra na dris //
translated: and the Digambaras, “Do you speak of what transcends existence and nonexistence?”

original: de phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni //🔽bstan pa 'chi med yod med las //
analyzed: de phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni // bstan pa 'chi med yod med las //
translated: Therefore, the teaching of the buddhas

original: 'das pa zab mo zhes bshad pa //🔽chos kyi khud pa yin zhes kyis //
analyzed: 'das pa zab mo zhes bshad pa // chos kyi khud pa yin zhes kyis //
translated: is said to be “profoundly beyond existence and nonexistence.”

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said to be “the essence of the Dharma.”

original: don dam pa mthong pa'i thabs su gyur pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: don dam pa mthong pa'i thabs su gyur pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because it is the means of seeing the ultimate.

original: gdul bya'i skye bo rnam pa de lta bu rtog pa'i ngor /
analyzed: gdul bya'i skye bo rnam pa de lta bu rtog pa'i ngor /
translated: In the perspective of the thought of those disciples,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs rje chen po'i gzhan gyi dbang nyid kyis mang po bkur pa'i gang zag tu smra ba ltar /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs rje chen po'i gzhan gyi dbang nyid kyis mang po bkur pa'i gang zag tu smra ba ltar /
translated: the Bhagavat, through the power of great compassion,

original: rnam par shes par smra ba drang ba'i don nyid du bstan gyi /
analyzed: rnam par shes par smra ba drang ba'i don nyid du bstan gyi /
translated: taught the doctrine of consciousness, which is interpretable in meaning,🔽in order to lead those who believe in the person as an aggregate.

original: nges pa'i don du ma yin no zhes shes par bya'o //🔽ji skad du /
analyzed: nges pa'i don du ma yin no zhes shes par bya'o // ji skad du /
translated: It should be understood that this is not the final truth.

original: 'phags pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po'i mdo las //
analyzed: 'phags pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po'i mdo las //
translated: As it is said in the noble Samādhirāja-sūtra,

original: stong pa bde bar gshegs pas bshad pa ltar //
analyzed: stong pa bde bar gshegs pas bshad pa ltar //
translated: As the Sugata has explained emptiness,

original: nges don mdo sde dag gi bye brag shes //
analyzed: nges don mdo sde dag gi bye brag shes //
translated: One should know the distinctions of the definitive scriptures.

original: gang las sems can gang zag skyes @93b bu bstan //
analyzed: gang las sems can gang zag skyes @93b bu bstan //
translated: In those scriptures where the person, the sentient being, the life-force,🔽The nourisher, the individual, the creature, the man,🔽The human, the human being, the one born of strength and semen,🔽The one born of Nārāyaṇa, are taught,

original: chos de thams cad drang ba'i don du shes //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos de thams cad drang ba'i don du shes // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: One should know that all those doctrines are of interpretable meaning.

original: 'di ni blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo la sogs pa dag las rgyas par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo la sogs pa dag las rgyas par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in detail from the Akṣayamatisūtra and so forth.

original: de'i phyir dam pa thar pa 'dod pa dag gis ji srid du dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba gnyis kyi glags yod pa de srid du 'khor ba yin no zhes rtogs par byas nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir dam pa thar pa 'dod pa dag gis ji srid du dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba gnyis kyi glags yod pa de srid du 'khor ba yin no zhes rtogs par byas nas /
translated: Therefore, those who desire the holy state of liberation should understand that as long as there is an opportunity for the two views of existence and nonexistence, there is cyclic existence.

original: lta ba 'di gnyis bsal te /
analyzed: lta ba 'di gnyis bsal te /
translated: Having eliminated these two views,

original: dbu ma'i lam ji lta ba bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam ji lta ba bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: they should meditate on the middle path, just as it is.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The Bhagavān has said:

original: thams cad bsam yas thams cad 'byung min pas //
analyzed: thams cad bsam yas thams cad 'byung min pas //
translated: Since all is inconceivable and nothing arises,🔽the knowledge of things and nonthings is destroyed.

original: dngos dang dngos med shes pa rnam par bshig / byis pa gang dag sems kyi dbang song ba //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med shes pa rnam par bshig / byis pa gang dag sems kyi dbang song ba //
translated: Those childish beings who are under the power of mind

original: de dag srid pa bye ba brgyar sdug bsngal //
analyzed: de dag srid pa bye ba brgyar sdug bsngal //
translated: suffer for a hundred million existences.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly:

original: sngon 'das dus kyi bskal pa bsam yas na //
analyzed: sngon 'das dus kyi bskal pa bsam yas na //
translated: In the past, in inconceivable eons,

original: mi yi gtso bo byung ba ngas dran te //
analyzed: mi yi gtso bo byung ba ngas dran te //
translated: I remember the appearance of a supreme being.

original: drang srong chen po gzings kyi don mdzad pa //
analyzed: drang srong chen po gzings kyi don mdzad pa //
translated: The great sage who acted for the benefit of the world

original: ming ni dngos po med las byung zhes bya //
analyzed: ming ni dngos po med las byung zhes bya //
translated: was named Asambhāṣya.

original: skyes ma thag tu mkha' la rab tu gnas //
analyzed: skyes ma thag tu mkha' la rab tu gnas //
translated: As soon as he was born, he remained in the sky.

original: chos rnams thams cad dngos po med par bstan //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad dngos po med par bstan //
translated: All phenomena are taught to be unreal.

original: de tshe de dang mthun par mtshan btags te /
analyzed: de tshe de dang mthun par mtshan btags te /
translated: At that time, in accordance with that, names are given,

original: sgras ni 'jig rten kun tu grags par byas //
analyzed: sgras ni 'jig rten kun tu grags par byas //
translated: and the sound is proclaimed throughout the world.

original: lha rnams thams cad rab tu sgra 'byin pa //
analyzed: lha rnams thams cad rab tu sgra 'byin pa //
translated: All the gods proclaim

original: dngos po med ces bya ba'i rgyal bar gyur //
analyzed: dngos po med ces bya ba'i rgyal bar gyur //
translated: the sound of the Victor, “unreal.”

original: skyes ma thag tu gom pa bdun bor te //
analyzed: skyes ma thag tu gom pa bdun bor te //
translated: As soon as he is born, he takes seven steps

original: rgyal bas chos rnams dngos po med par bshad //
analyzed: rgyal bas chos rnams dngos po med par bshad //
translated: and the Victor explains that phenomena are unreal.

original: thub pa ches rnams thams cad ston pa yi //
analyzed: thub pa ches rnams thams cad ston pa yi //
translated: When the Buddha, the teacher of all sages,

original: sangs rgyas chos kyi rgyal por nam gyur tshe /
analyzed: sangs rgyas chos kyi rgyal por nam gyur tshe /
translated: becomes the king of the Dharma,

original: rtsva shing gel pa sman ri brag rnams las //
analyzed: rtsva shing gel pa sman ri brag rnams las //
translated: from the grass, trees, medicinal plants, and mountains

original: chos rnams dngos po med ces sgra yang 'byung //
analyzed: chos rnams dngos po med ces sgra yang 'byung //
translated: the sound of “unreal phenomena” arises.

original: 'jig rten de na ji snyed sgra yod pa //
analyzed: 'jig rten de na ji snyed sgra yod pa //
translated: Whatever sounds there are in the world

original: thams cad dngos med ci yang med pa zhes //
analyzed: thams cad dngos med ci yang med pa zhes //
translated: all proclaim, “unreal” and “nothing at all.”

original: de lta bur ni 'jig rten 'dren pa yi //
analyzed: de lta bur ni 'jig rten 'dren pa yi //
translated: In that way, from the Teacher of the World

original: sgra dbyangs rnam pa shin tu 'byung bar 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sgra dbyangs rnam pa shin tu 'byung bar 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
translated: the sound of the Dharma arises.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin mi 'thad pa yi phyir //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin mi 'thad pa yi phyir //
translated: Because the nature of things is untenable.

original: chos rnams dngos po med ces sgra yang 'byung //
analyzed: chos rnams dngos po med ces sgra yang 'byung //
translated: The sound “things are unreal” also occurs.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo'i don khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo'i don khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: Thus, one should understand the meaning of the sūtra.

original: 'jig rten de na ji sred sgra yod pa //
analyzed: 'jig rten de na ji sred sgra yod pa //
translated: Whatever sounds there are in the world,

original: thams cad dngos med ci yang med pa ste //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung bas na /
analyzed: thams cad dngos med ci yang med pa ste // zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung bas na /
translated: all are unreal and nonexistent.

original: med par dgag pa brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'i don ni rang bzhin med pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: med par dgag pa brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'i don ni rang bzhin med pa'i don yin no //
translated: Thus, because it is asserted to be a negation of nonexistence, the meaning of “unreal” is the meaning of “natureless.”

original: slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i @94a * //
analyzed: slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i @94a * //
translated: The master Candrakīrti

original: zhal snga nas sbyar ba'i tshig gsal ba las /
analyzed: zhal snga nas sbyar ba'i tshig gsal ba las /
translated: in his Clear Words:

original: rang bzhin brtag pa zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa bco lnga ba'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: rang bzhin brtag pa zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa bco lnga ba'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: A Commentary on the “Supplement to the Middle Way”🔽says:

original: // /'dir smras pa /🔽dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni yod pa nyid de /
